Reviews.Title: “Great service at a great location”
Reviews.Author: vermonter54
Reviews.Content: Our first impression was of the fantastic harbor view. Our room was very good though it had an airport view. There was no problem with airport noise. The restaurant had excellent food (try the chowder and the lobster omelet). There is access to a water taxi that will bring you to the North End for a great price. The best part is the service. The staff consistently went out of the way to ensure that we were happy. They are the biggest reason for the great review!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: dennis1980
Reviews.Content: The room had a great view of the city and was very modern and nice. The only issue i had was a dirty shower. The tile was dirty and was kind of gross. Everything else was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: Only reason to stay here is if you are landing late in Boston or leaving really early. If you have time and want to go downtown, take the water taxi right outside. The hotel is totally fine but definitely designed for airport travelers or car rental patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent harbor view”
Reviews.Author: a_ram_cow
Reviews.Content: The room in this large hotel is decent, clean and quiet. No noise from the airport what so ever. The view from the window was fabulous. I sat there for half an hour to watch the sunset and downtown Boston. Would never forget the bueaty of that harbor. There's a great fitness facility too. Large family friendly pool and hot tub, great treadmills. I chose to run ourside along the peaceful harbor. The downside is that I feel the room was kind of small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: PDXBigGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a weekend and was quite pleased overall. The staff was very friendly and competent. The breakfast was great. Some shortcomings in the room itself. I would definitely stay here again. PROS: ROOM: had a harborview room on the 12th floor (top is 15) which had a great view of downtown Boston, especially at night. The room was spacious and clean; the bed quite comfy. ELEVATORS: 3 of the fastest elevators I've ever been on in a hotel. Over my stay, I never waited more than 5 seconds for an elevator. BREAKFAST: complimentary Full breakfast at Harborside Grill (lobby restaurant) for Diamond Gold Passport members. No coupons, just charge to room and removed. Yurio is especially friendly and efficient, but all are great. INTERNET ACCESS: free to Diamond and Platinum members. Both wired and wireless available, average speed for hotel HSIA. Just accept charges on screen though you are not actually charged on your folio. FREE SHUTTLE SERVICE: pretty much runs continuously between all airport terminals, the MBTA airport station, and the hotel. You are supposed to call the Hotel for pick-up; there is a free courtesy phone in baggage claim. MassPort also runs a shuttle (route 66) from all terminals, to the MBTA airport station, and then to the ferry dock next to the Hotel--it's free but not as reliable as the Hotel's shuttle. The subway stop at the airport is NOT within walking distance of the Hotel--and you're talking to someone who likes to walk! It's a very convoluted path I would not even attempt. FITNESS CENTER: 3 treadmills, 1 elliptical,1 bike, and weight machines. The room is large, well-ventilated, and looks out on the water. CONS: ROOM: thin walls. Seem to hear more of neighbors and hallway activities than average BATHROOM: no towels bars! There is a single hook behind the door. I'm baffled. There is definitely enough room for a bar next to the sink and bathtub. The bathtub spout is a firehose--way, way overpressured. The showerhead could use a flow restrictor too. ANALOG TV: this is an older flat-panel on the smaller side. The analog resolution is pretty horrible; Is HD programming out of the hotel's budget? FITNESS CENTER: no small workout towels. Had to snag the gigantic bath towels from the pool area. There was a fridge for "chilled" towels but I just want a normal room temperature towel like most hotels supply. I suppose I could bring the small hand towel from my room. While I enjoyed this hotel overall, it may not be a good "base" hotel if you want to tour Boston because of the required "shuttling." The water taxi, at $10 for a one-way trip, while convenient, is prohibitively expensive compared to the 7-day $15 MBTA pass. But if the room rates are good and you don't mind the extra time to get into Boston, then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bella349
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here to have a girls night out and watch the Oscars. It was exactly what you would expect from a Hyatt property...very clean rooms with very comfortable bedding, nice restaurant and lobby area. One thing that did SHINE SHINE SHINE at the Harborside was the hotel staff. It would be hard to throw out names because it started with the Valet then rolled into the young man at the front desk who were both efficient and courteous. The bartender really knew her drinks and offered great suggestions and the house specialty. The next morning we had wonderful sevice in the restaurant from a waiter ( I think his name was Carlos ), even the house keeping staff on the 15th floor were very pleasant. The front desk allowed us to check out late. This gave us time to enjoy the workout room , which had very up to date equiptment and the pool. My job allows me to travel often and think the Hyatts always do a great job. Mr. Hickey you have a very well run Hotel l!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay at Logan”
Reviews.Author: familyinnh
Reviews.Content: Heading out for an early AM flight and spent the night with my family. 1st room smelled of tobacco-- they moved us to a new room without any issues or fuss. The bellman took care of everything. Restaurant is great with beautiful view of the harbor. Nice place all around.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive, enjoyable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: kakistoc
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times when flying out of Boston. The rooms are large, clean and attractive, with two queen-size beds which work well for our family. The staff are all helpful, the restaurant is good and the views are outstanding. The shuttle to the airport is very efficient and they will also collect you from car hire sites. In fact we find it more convenient than the Hilton, which is theoretically in walking distance of Logan but actually quite a way to go with luggage. If I have a complaint, it is that it seems a tiny bit expensive for what it is; but maybe that's just Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but paper thin construction”
Reviews.Author: scarvalho7
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel. Our first stay was memorable -- great view and outdoor dining at a great price. Our second stay over the weekend unfortunately was not so great as there were people next to us and you could literally hear them talk as if they were in your room. While we were equally pleased with the restaurant and service both at dinner and breakfast, if you can't get a good night sleep, then what's the point. The hotels should invest a little more money in construction and noise proofing.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice within 6 months!”
Reviews.Author: sabrinacat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding in October and it was perfect! We were only there for one night but all was great and they did a fantastic job on the wedding. We also ordered room service since we had way too much to drink but from what I can remember the lobster mac and cheese was delish!!! For breakfast I had the lobster omellette and it was outstanding. We came back in January for a chess tournament-not sure why the room rate was 100 dollars less per night from what it was in October at the wedding, but again a great time, I sat in the bar most of the time and the service all around was great! We love this hotel and will return next year if they host again for another chess tournament!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb view!”
Reviews.Author: M303
Reviews.Content: Take an ocean view room otherwise don't bother going there because the whole point of this hotel is to benefit from the view! The view is absolutely incredible whether from the room or the restaurant, whether indoor or even outdoor where you can relax on the grass in front of the ocean. If you don't care about the view, you can't afford or you're not willing to pay that much for an ocean view room, don't go there! Go to a hotel in downtown (DT) instead. Airport in Boston is really close to DT so if you think you'd be late to your flight by taking a hotel there you're wrong... The room was nice and up to the standards, but nothing special (the room could be more spacious) Since the hotel is not at walking distance from downtown you'll need to take public transportation (cab, boat shuttle...) It was a nice experience overall but next time I go to Boston I'll stay in DT because it's more practical. Ideally I would stay between this hotel and another one in DT...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Barry F
Reviews.Content: The room was awsome . The view from our room was incredible.The service secound to nobody. I cant say enough about the staff they are excellent. It was the nicest hotel I ever stayed in. It was clean and the food great. It has one of the nicest gyms ive seen in a hotel. I would like to thank Louis for the upgrade. He was great . The hyatt is lucky to have him. The water taxi takes you to the north end in 5 minutes, it cost 10 buck or 17 both ways. Which was the best way to go. I would recomend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to normal Hyatt standard”
Reviews.Author: tonitone
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a very convenient business hotel, but didn't quite measure up to the normal quality of Hyatt brand: Pros: - Near to airport, free shuttle bus - Nice meeting rooms - Friendly staff - Bar open until 1am - Boat directly into Boston from hotel Cons: - Rooms are just OK, clean enough but ordinary - Movies are $18 - Food in hotel restaurant is distinctly average - Breakfast is good, but really expensive - Loudness: walls are paper thin and you can hear everything All in all, I gave it 3 stars because my company paid for the trip, otherwise I would have rated it as a 2

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Boston-The views are the best I've ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: MCMinor
Reviews.Content: Phenominal service and very clean rooms! The staff made me feel so comfortable and was always asking if I needed anything. Very professional and warm. The rooms are immaculate as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Short of Perfection”
Reviews.Author: facorsig
Reviews.Content: We chose this location for relief from suburb based family. We were given a room over looking the harbor. Simply, the best hotel view I have ever had. Staff were exceptionally helpful and engaged throughout the stay. Bar is unique and restaurants were always well occupied. This property is what I expect from Hyatt and the delivery exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra quiet airport hotel, nice staff, expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: cheapskate1959
Reviews.Content: I stay here when I need to take the early morning flight from Boston to London. During peak season, the price becomes very high, but in winter the prices are very fair for such a lovely property. Unlike most chain hotels it also has a decent restaurant with great views of the Boston Harbour. Every room seems to have a great view either of the harbour or the runways of Logan. Despite its end of runway location it is dead quiet in the rooms. MY only complaint is internet, which in this day and age should be free. $12.95 for slow speed limited bandwidth (no VOIP), much much more for higher bandwidth and no limits on file size. If you are a true cheapskate go over to the airport -- Logan has free wi-fi through out the airport!

Reviews.Title: “OK Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AFrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before but this was my first stay for a couple of years. The check in was efficient and all the staff I met were very pleasant. Room service food was very good even if my food wasn't exactly what I had ordered. The biggest problem was the noise. There were a bunch of guys in 1217 who thought that they were on spring break. Shouting in their room could be heard the length of the corridor and they kept roaming around shouting and screaming at the top of their voices. I'll probably try the Hilton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View and deacent stay for business”
Reviews.Author: ScottyA320
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Hotel - the rooms are fair sized; not big but not too small. The layout of the room provides adequate space to work. Climate control in my room was ok; couldn't dial it in for a comfy temp though. I was given a room on the 9th floor facing the harbor which had a spectacular view of Boston's skyline. The restaurant's food was very good (but a little pricy.) Positives: The house keepers, servers and floor management were outstanding; everyone seemed to go out of their way to make sure I was content. Negatives: Poor service at reception (front desk) both at check in and check out. If you book for business and your room and tax are paid through your company's direct bill, be careful! They lost my billing information prior to check in and again at check out. I was delayed 40 minutes checking in. The blonde haired gentleman at check out on Friday morning January 27th was short, snappy and flat out rude and didn't seem to have an interest to look into the billing problem. He said there wasn't any other alternative but to charge my personal credit card which was on file. Charges for services I didn't use were applied to my bill; restaurant charge and room service charge. I asked for his manager; the manager amended the billing problem immediately - billing agreement from my company was found and applied - after 20 minutes... There are equal or better Hotels in the area which I have used without the problems I encountered..

Reviews.Title: “choice of room seems to matter!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea N
Reviews.Content: we happened to be in Boston on a business trip during Columbus day weekend. also there were 3 weddings in the hotel. the hotel is huge and staff is excellent. the view is stunning and the downtown accessibility via water taxi wonderful. food is also excellent and the rooms are spacious. BUT: we were given a room facing the airport (had no choice since the place was booked solid) and first noticed a constant humming. since the vending machine was right next to the room we thought it's this one and switched room. same side of the building. same humming. we then found out, that this comes from the aircon. they have individual aircon for each room, connected via ducts. and as I read here in other reviews. we got one of the rooms where the walls are paper thin. one could here the aircon's humming from rooms surrounding, people talking etc... sleep was therefore not an option. since we had to prepare meetings, work and be fit in the mornings that was the worst. cause what really do I expect form a hotel? good sleep, exactly. when complaining at the reception they sent a mechanic, but what will this one do.... we also had a constantly dripping faucet that could not be fixed.... we are really no picky people, but that was unacceptable for the price we had to pay per night: 220$. unfortunately all of Boston was booked solid so we couldn't relocate. sorry to say that, but we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Friendly Too”
Reviews.Author: MVeeC
Reviews.Content: Over two winter weekends I have had most pleasurable times visiting this hotel, staying in great rooms with fantastic city-scape views across the harbor. Everyone was super helpful, including a concierge who went out of his way twice to secure impossible to get tickets. Plus my friends and I a delicious late night dining experience--can't beat that lobster roll. In a city where traffic is a royal pain, being minutes away from BOS by shuttle (driven by a terrific local) is my idea of a smart way to visit this great city. This is a super Hyatt which I fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kjdj28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in mid November 2011 and couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. Had some trouble with a piece of luggage being broken by the shuttle driver, but when we arrived at the hotel, the manager was more than apologetic and took care of us. Since we had just arrived on a red eye, they made sure that they had a waterfront room made available for us and gave our family of 4 a complimentary breakfast in the restaurant. It was delicious! The manager then proceeded to go to the samsonite store and replace our broken piece of luggage for an upgraded piece so that we could have it to continue on our vacation. We were treated with so much respect and courtesy that it was unbelievable. The waterfront view rooms have stunning views of the harbor and the water taxi's are easily accessible making it very easy to get into the city. I would very much visit this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay before flight”
Reviews.Author: RJS and Gale
Reviews.Content: An impending snow and ice storm due the day of our flight had us searching for a Boston hotel to stay at to avoid driving problems. While there were less expensive hotels nearby, their low Tripadvisor ratings scared us off. The ratings for this hotel were decent, and the AAA price was reasonable ($191, including breakfast for two) so we opted for the Hyatt right at the airport. The quality of the room, the building in general, and the excellent breakfast would have rated 4 stars. But, the amazing staff brought it up to five. Whom ever does the staff hiring and training should get a bonus for the great job s/he does. Thanks to all of them for making life so easy!

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two visits....”
Reviews.Author: Jeckertny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two consecutive weekends this month and had two radically different experiences. Our first trip we simply took a cab the short distance to the hotel, checked in smoothly (and VERY early after a red eye) to a new, quiet room with strong internet and a great view (the sunset was spectacular). We used the shuttle to get to the T and the airport with no complaints. The following weekend was a completely different hotel. First, we were left stranded at the airport in 6 degree temperatures waiting for the shuttle -- despite multiple calls -- before taking a cab. We were given a room on a floor that reeked of smoke and had partiers roaming the halls and shouting from rooms. We were booked into another room on a different floor that clearly had walls made of tissue paper. We were woken early by a crying baby several rooms away and could here every ablution by our neighbor the next morning. To be fair, Joe and Max were extremely apologetic, did all they could and comped a few things. Apparently our story made its way around the hotel because we were treated extremely well the following days.

Reviews.Title: “Fab airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SYD-YYZ
Reviews.Content: My husband loved this hotel and choose to stay here every time the day before his return to Sydney. The rooms are spacious and the restaurant faces the beautiful harbor. Service is always top notch. Rates are reasonable through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as we expected”
Reviews.Author: trustwhatisay
Reviews.Content: Hyatt as a brand is very good. The location to the airport was brilliant for us and the shuttle collected us from the airport very promptly, took us to the metro stop so we could explore the city, and was right outside when we needed to catch our flights. The concierge and shuttle service was top notch. The room was large, quiet, and had all the amenities. The other way to get into the city is via boat taxi and the dock is directly out the back door of the hotel. The only negative was at breakfast where the son of one of the breakfast staff was seated at the table next to us and received better service than us and all for free. He then had the hotel staff running around helping him jump start his car. Its bad form to judge a person on appearance so I must tread carefully here but he was a little rough around the edges and was a distraction in a very nice setting. On the bright side the restaurant had a tv by the buffet that was showing the Blackburn v Man United game and the result cheered me up. Overall the hotel delivered exactly what we expected but skip the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, Need to Upgrade Amenities to Reflect Standard Set By Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate2855
Reviews.Content: First of all, do not use a GPS if you are arriving by car. It took us an hour hitting closed streets, not known by GPS. I called the hotel, and I think Bobby the Concierge Mamger talked us in. Being very frazzled, he very kindly offered to comp our parking which was a classy move. The hotel is gorgeous. The lobby is spacious and quite inviting considering how large it was. I liked the there is a lovely restaurant adjacent to the lobby, which had delicious Food and a stunning view of Boston Harbor, overlooking the downtown skyline. The elevator had surrounding windows, so you can see the lovely view as you ascend to you room. We were on the 11th floor, the rooms were on the small side for a hotel of this stature. I did enjoy this hotel enough that Even with the things wrong with it I will list below, I think I'd stay there again and take the water taxi or Subway into the heart of Boston. Some things need fixing. There is NO need for a hotel with this many rooms, catering to many business customers to charge $12.95 PER unit for Internet. Definitely take my advice!! This hotel competes with much higher end hotels for the same type of costomer. Free Internet could make the difference to budget minded companies choose this Hyatt! Also, the heating systems are terrible. We had to turn ours off, but then the people next door had theirs on and it sounded like a freight train was coming through our room. We can't be the only ones mentioning this! We Changed rooms but it's evidently a flaw hotel-wide. This is the first 4-star hotel I've stayed in with this heating issue. This is a 1-2 star hotel issue!! The parking is over priced for the area and they should think about lowering those rates a bit (although our's was comped, I am just passing along information. I'm going to nitpick here: more glasses, hand towels, washclothes, and towels should be in each room. It felt like the barest minimum was given for our use. A bottle of Aquafina Water went for $5.00. REALLY!!! I've stayed in some very pricey hotels, and they might charge $5.00 for bottled water in the room, but it's Evian or comperable water. One more nitpick. I'd called for extra pillows, but it took them an hour and a half to get to us. They SHOULD have free bathrobes in every room at that level! Two big things to rave about: the bed certainly was heavenly, I slept better than at home. And Bobby, the Manager Concierge, was truly exemplary at helping us overcome several problems. A really terrific young guy, named Devon helped get us a 4:00 checkout the next day, as we were picking someone up coming from Seattle and the plane wasn't scheduled to arrive until 5:30 that afternoon. It allowed my husband to nap comfortably as we were driving 250 miles after we picked them up to go home. As I said before, dinner was very, very good in the restaurant, which looked over at the Boston skyline and was quite spectacular as all the building across the river were lighted up. Very lovely! A very nice gentleman named Denice waited on us. While we were waiting in the lobby for the plane to arrive the next afternoon, we were well taken care of. Jorje came over, introduced himself to us and asked if we needed or wanted ANYthing at all. Several waiters did the same thing followed by a big smile and even offered us a glass of water (free, I assume) while we waited. I guess I want to say that the level of amazing pampering appears slightly out of sync with the level of amenities and I think corporate needs to offer the whole package if they want to upgrade their image as a whole. You have amazing people who go out of their way to help out and/or make things more comfortable. You do them a disservice by not offering a classy, unique room to go with it! I want to thank Bobby, Devon, Jorje and Denice and every single other person on staff at Hilton Harborside for helping to make this trip a fun trip in the end and let them know I'll be back next time if for nothing else, but for the top-notch way they all helped us out under all circumstances. Come here for the vacation, or shopping, or just to wait for a flight. Stay and enjoy pretty much the best staff I've met at any hotel ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfotraveler9
Reviews.Content: This struck me as a really well-run hotel. All of the staff without exception were friendly and helpful. The hotel's shuttle was prompt and I also used it also to access the subway station to get into the city. The restaurant seems to do a good business which is always a good sign. I had dinner at the bar and enjoyed the convivial atmosphere and good service. All of the waitstaff and bartenders seemed upbeat and friendly. The restaurant has an interesting menu and you can order anything from a basic sandwich to a nice dinner. I thought the food was good and reasonably priced. My room was well-appointed and comfortable. I was initially put in a room with a spectacular harbor view but the noise from the neighboring room via a shared door was really bad..the people in the next room weren't making excessive noise but nearly every sound came through the door. I asked to be moved to another room and the desk clerk gladly accommodated my request. The second room did not have the great view but was nice and quiet. Just bring some earplugs and you will have a great stay. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good :-)”
Reviews.Author: SiSallam
Reviews.Content: Have been there for six nights. View on the harbor, clean rooms Excellent location 8 min drive to down town or 10 min by taxi water concierge very helpful (tks Derek) Tub and toilet drains to be improoved

Reviews.Title: “Here's the good and bad, you be the judge”
Reviews.Author: GiftBizGuy
Reviews.Content: Spent the night at this hotel after flying back from Europe rather than driving onward. We had a mixed experience... GOOD - Overall tidy appearance in room. - Good bed. - Great view of the Boston waterfront. - Prompt pick-up and drop-off. - Courteous bellmen, waiters, desk clerk. BAD - Loud throbbing heating unit in room. - Noises from the hall. - Poor drainage in the tub. By the end of my shower I was standing in 2" of soapy water. - Absolutely hideous distasteful breakfast. Actually the waiter told me that they get many complains on the waffles I selected and he comped my meal. - And the worst for me, a van driver who fervently imposed his religious beliefs on me. He asked if I had celebrated Christmas in the Netherlands (where we had been on holiday) and I told him that we had enjoyed the seasonal good will and cheer (I was trying to be diplomatic). He then proceeded to urgently recommend that I accept Christ as my personal savior and began to tell me how my life would change for the better. Next he dropped me at the wrong exit to retrieve my parked car. I don't think this sort of aggressive missionary work is part of the Hyatt training manual. So is this a 4-star or 3-star or 2-star experience? I say two.

Reviews.Title: “All Perfect Boston Hotel ..”
Reviews.Author: evajulez
Reviews.Content: Reasonable PRICE, Free Shuttle to/from Airport 24 hrs. Gorgeous city view from Harborside Grill inside Restaurant & rooms. Full GYM, Sauna, heated pool, Jacuzzi. Spacious comfortable room. Free Refrigerator upon request. CANT BEAT IT !!

Reviews.Title: “Best staff EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: skymom05
Reviews.Content: If you would like to stay at a hotel in Boston with the BEST view of the city and the most wonderful and courteous staff, this is the place. It is just a ten minute water taxi ride into the city and then you can settle in for the evening, when you come back, for a delicious dinner and a breathtaking view.I want to thank the entire staff from the desk people ,waiters and managers for treating me like a queen, best two day vacation I ever had!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: csteets
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I highly recommend this place. Great views of the harbor plus theres ferry service right in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient for the airport, good room”
Reviews.Author: MassiG
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt had great service, a nice room, comfortable bed, good bathroom. It is very convenient for the airport with a 5 minutes shuttle ride to the airport. The room is very spacious, nicely decorated. Internet is a little pricey at $12.95 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Best view of the harbor!”
Reviews.Author: bisbohemian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my way out of Boston. I HIGHLY recommend this place if you have an early morning flight out of Logan. The room was typical of a modern Hyatt, but the view out the windows were AWESOME! The entire "odd side" rooms have a view of Boston Harbor and the skyline. Had room service - which was fast, friendly and tasty. Would I stay here again? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding View of the Boston Cityscape”
Reviews.Author: katefromboston
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to spend Thanksgiving weekend at the Hyatt Harborside. My friend and I had a 2-room suite with a fantastic view. The hotel is a short ($17pp roundtrip) water taxi ride from the hotel to the Quincy Market area of Boston. It is also about a 2 minute ride to any airline terminal from the hotel. The rooms were clean and well maintained with updated furnishings and electronics. Both room service and housekeeping were stellar. I can not say enough about the food that we had while at this hotel. It far exceeded my expectations! If you stay there and eat at the Brunch Buffet keep your fingers crossed that they have the bread pudding like dish out. All I can say is..........YUM! We also ate dinner there 2 nights and I never experienced a bad dish or service. I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding views”
Reviews.Author: KCTraveler6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night at the end of our stay in Boston. The view harborside is as advertised, very impressive. Check in was fine although the service by the doormen throughout clearly over shadowed the front desk staff in our interaction with them. Our room on the 10th floor was clean and comfortable with very modern and well kept furnishings. We had no issues with noise either from the airport or other guest. The first day there they had two shuttles running to the â€œTâ€� subway stop and the airport. The shuttle driver made sure we knew to call the hotel when we returned for the evening to get a ride back from the subway when were back for the evening. The T is very convenient, we took the it 4 stops into Boston (on the blue line) and walked around Faneuil Hall/ Quincy Market and the North End grabbing some pastries at Mikes. We did have an (overpriced) beer from the hotel bar in the evening and the service was good. The next day we had room service breakfast which was served quickly and was great. We did not use any of the other amenities while onsite though. There was a less than 10 min wait the second day for the shuttle for the airport but the bell staff made sure we were apprised on the status of the shuttle and asked if they could get us anything while we were waiting. Again the shuttle driver was very friendly and gave us exact directions on how to get to the ticketing desk when he dropped us off at the airport. Although this is an airport hotel, depending on the price compared to hotels in town Iâ€™d consider staying here even for an extended stay in Boston as the subway system is very easy and economical to get around on.

Reviews.Title: “The front door guys most helpful! They are what made this hotel excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mista_Sizzla
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent the weekend in Boston and got to visit this beautiful city. Although the check in staff was basically non existent and not all that helpful. What allowed us to give a higher rating then we would have otherwise, was the guys at the desk when you walk in on the left. They were the most helpful, had great tips on travelling around the city and the fastest forms of transportation. Bobby Stone and his colleagues really exemplified the meaning of customer service and hospitality. If it wasn't for them this hotel wouldn't be any different from a Motel 6. We especially found it an inconvenience that wi if was not included when most other hotels, Starbucks and even McDonalds provide complimentary wi if to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for 1 night for a wedding - but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: HoboHealth
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong - this is a nice, new hotel with many amenities, including (expensive) valet parking and good service, but I think for its location and usual purpose, it was WAY overpriced. Even with a wedding block discount. The wedding was held inside the hotel, and it just felt very canned, like there could've been weddings going on in all the other conference rooms at the same time. The area around the hotel is definitely growing and someday may be more of a destination like downtown Boston, but I think until then, I'd rather stay downtown for the money. What was good was that everything is almost new so it's very clean and modern and the room was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Sinbad55
Reviews.Content: From the time we were picked up by a friendly, helpful driver of the shuttle van, until checkout, my wife and I had a great stay at the Harborside. We spent one night there on November 3rd before our flight to Orlando to meet our family flying in from Norway to visit Disney World. At check in we were greeted by: "May I help our next guest?", a fresh and welcoming greeting. We had been put on the 15th floor and my wife who likes lower floors asked if we could be moved. Our most helpful front desk person, without hesitation, said there would be no problem, and immediately moved us to the third floor. Our room and bed were most comfortable with a fabulous view of the harbor and Boston. We ate in the restaurant and the food and service was excellent. Our waiters were helpful, friendly, personable and efficient. During our meal, a gentleman came to our table and asked for our opinion about our experience at the hotel thus far. Wow! We had the feeling that we were staying at a highly rated boutique hotel. Our room was one hundred dollars cheaper than a room at the Hilton where I have stayed three times without any friendliness or remarkable service. I highly suggest staying at the Hyatt Harborside. We'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view, but need to pay wifi”
Reviews.Author: Kayconnie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night, bed is extremely comfortable, but just one disadvantage - I need to pay for Internet, which is not good for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific view and good food”
Reviews.Author: butterfly63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and the view over the harbor was stunning from our room 601 and the restaurant. Bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious with a sitting area composed of small sofa plus two chairs. Only problem during the stay was accessing the internet but this was resolved by calling their helpline. Ate breakfast and two evening meals here and the chef really pays attention to the small details. Bread is made in house and the pastries at breakfast plus the granola were also excellent. Water taxi is right outside but fares can add up quickly. Ask the hotel for a couple of free tickets!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynne B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Harborside for two nights in a harbour view room on the third floor at the end of October (arriving on the day of the snow!). The room was great with all amenities, although a minibar would have been good, and such an amazing view of the city - for two first time visitors to Boston, what more could we ask for. The staff at the hotel were extremely courteous, friendly and always willing to help. We got excellent travel advice from the concierge, the waiting staff in the restaurant were good and the front desk was also great when we requested an extra blanket late in the evening. Although not in the centre of Boston, it was so easy to get the free shuttle bus to the T (subway) station and then just $2 a trip. On the way back just rang the hotel for a pick up at the station and the bus was there within minutes - fantastic! Also try the indoor pool - a swim with a fantastic view of Boston! Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Harborside at Boston's Logan International Airport”
Reviews.Author: Letfreedomring1876
Reviews.Content: The room accomodations were excellent. The room was clean and the magnificent view of the harbor was priceless. The front desk service was excellent in providing room information. The hotel is ideally located near the airport and airport blue line subway station. They even provide a free shuttle service to the airport and the subway station. The Boston Harbor water taxi station is located in front of the hotel. The cost of the water taxi is $10.00 one way and $17.00 round trip. The subway is $2.00 each way. I had used the "7 day Charlie Pass" which provided unlimited trips on the subway and buses. The cost for that was $15.00. The luxury was superior to others in its class.

Reviews.Title: “Best View in Town”
Reviews.Author: kenpat
Reviews.Content: Spent our last nite in New England at the Hyatt. No words could describe how great the view is. We had a million dollar view from our room on the 11th floor. The outside patio is very relaxing and again, a great view. The water taxi is right outside the back door and the hotel shuttle will bring you to the "T" (subway) whenever you request. We called for pick up at the T and the shuttle was there to pick us up within 10 minutes. We sat outside one evening for a drink but because the restaurant was busy nobody came out to serve us. Was a bit of pain because when I went into the bar to get our drinks the bartender was very busy and the wait was painful. So I have to give the outdoor bar service an "F". Even though they had the outdoor fires going etc there was no service at all. The only downside is double beds. Many chain hotels are getting away from two Queen Beds and Doubles are way too confining. Other than the bed situation everything else was perfect. To find fault with the Hyatt would be to nitpick. It is an airport hotel BUT with a view that you'd be sure to enjoy - just make sure you stay on the city side.

Reviews.Title: “Late Night Arrival Wonderful Reception -”
Reviews.Author: YawarMailku
Reviews.Content: We were accomodated by Hyatt after a bobbled reservation at another hotel. We were lucky at this upgrade. The food was excellent, the room more than expected and the view across the Bay to Boston was worth the price of admission. The Breakfast in the morning was standard fare at Boston prices. We would stay here on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding Service - a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJ00174
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Harborside is a great hotelâ€”plain and simple. My wife and I stayed there years ago when it first opened and have returned there as a family a couple of time since. Every single visit has been great. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the view on the harborside is spectacular. The restaurant is also comfortable and the food is tasty. Aside from the facilities, we have found all of the staff: shuttle bus driver, check in clerk, manager and wait staff alike, to friendly, courteous and helpful (I have to single out Yuri in the restaurant). On our last stay we accidentally left a small bag behind and only realized it was missing when we were supposed to be boarding our international flight at the airport. With only 30 minutes before take-off we called the hotel and Alison, the Duty Manager sprang in to action and managed to get the bag rushed over to the airport in time for us to get on our flight. I travel around the world and have stayed in 5 star hotels in New York, London, Sydney, Barcelona, Bangkok, Singapore, Washington, Charlotte, Warsaw, Milan and more in the past year - it is rare to encounter this level of customer service anywhere, but if you are smart enough to book in at the Hyatt Harborside you can experience for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: MassGuy2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding (an amazing wedding venue), hotel is great. The view of Boston is breathtaking, and it is right on the harbor. Rooms are nice, staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of Boston, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: CWSJ
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 4 nights over Columbus Day weekend. The view of Boston and the harbor is gorgeous. The room was clean, spacious, comfortable love seat, bed and desk. Although it's close to the airport, we heard very little plane or airport noise. Our room had an interior door connecting to the next room. We could hear the next door guests quite clearly (not so with the guests on the other side of us where there was no interior connecting door) and also room doors slamming and guests talking in the hallway while we were trying to sleep. We recently stayed at a Hyatt Summerfield Suites, where they have a "quiet" policy, asking guests to be a bit quieter after 9pm while talking in their rooms or in the hallway. Hyatt should consider a similar policy at all of its hotels. We had breakfast Saturday morning. The food was good, but unfortunately the service was terrible. Our waiter was disorganized, he kept hanging out in the buffet area, we had to beg for a coffee refill. When our food arrived, we asked the food server for coffee, but he referred us to our waiter, saying he just delivered food. A waitress from a nearby table refilled our coffee, she was very friendly, and I think she felt sorry for us. The lobby staff were helpful and friendly, I appreciated that we got a late checkout when I asked for it, since our flight left in the late afternoon. Since we didn't have a car, we used the free shuttle to the subway and to the airport. Drivers were friendly, helpful, and the shuttle came within minutes, even to pick us up at the subway station to bring us back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: nearLeekMolax
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good and the staff very helpful. Good location by the airport and not noisy best way to access the city was by water taxi. The hotel restaurant was excellant very good food, a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor side room had spectacular view.”
Reviews.Author: 214valentine
Reviews.Content: This hotel has airport views or harbor views. Be sure to opt for harbor view which was spectacular. A large window had good black out shades to keep room dark early morning. Room was spacious and well appointed. Bathroom had no vent fan which explained why there was mildew growing in the grout in the shower surround. Room temperature was not regulated at night by room thermostat - room got stuffy even though thermostat set at 70. Restaurant was surprisingly good for a hotel and prices were in keeping with the location. Harbor taxis serve nearby dock to get guests across the harbor and into the city. Beware that the service shuts down fairly early. Airport shuttle was available with very short wait. If you are using Garmin GPS be sure to get alternate route advice from another source. The Chelsea Street Bridge which is part of the Garmin route is closed for reconstruction and Nuvi wasn't very helpful for alternate route.

Reviews.Title: “Not just an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FivestarScotland
Reviews.Content: Logan Airport is so close to Boston that its hotels are not just places for a night before a flight home. This hotel is wonderfully situated, right across the bay from the Boston waterfront. The water taxi comes on demand to the hotel jetty - $17 return to Rowes Wharf. Ask for a room with bay view - it is outstanding. Staff extremely helpful. There is also a private shuttle bus to all terminals and it is on the stop for the bus to all car rental depots. Nowhere takes more than 10 minutes.You can sit on the terrace and gaze across at the Boston lights - the photo on this webpage is accurate ! Rooms are large and comfortable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, views, location and food.”
Reviews.Author: VIPbeachguest
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Boston. Its not hard to find your way back if get lost. Venture out and all the road signs will lead you back to Logan and the hotel. Looked for great seafood in Boston while there and ate at several good restaurants. But found the best lobster roll by far in Boston to be at the hotel itself on the last day. I would make the extra effort to just go eat there the next time I go to or thru Boston. The sunset from the restaurant was spectacular. The room was modern and clean. Front desk service was more than asked for as with the bell hops. Thirty-two bucks to self park was kind of high but then it was forty-five to park downtown. I guess that's why the push public transportation in Boston. If you have no car, you can shuttle/taxi to a lot of things nearby. A couple of cool beaches are about 15min drive from the hotel if you need some sand and sun. This place is ideal for layovers.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: s Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed ther end of August after a transatlantic flight into Boston, the hotel is not right on the airport but worth the extra mile. The hotel itself is ok, Hyatt standart in the beige-brown design, breakfast buffet was included in our rate and rather good, but not too cheap for $24 if booked extra. What makes the hotel special is the location - directly opposite to downtown Boston with great views over the water, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Voyager042
Reviews.Content: We had a night here before flying home and would always stay here again. Reception was very helpful even before we arrived, arranging an early check-in for us and all of the staff were most helpful. The room was large, clean and very comfortable, with a lovely view of the City across the harbour. There is a nice, heated pool and a gym. Breakfast was good, if not cheap. Transport links are excellent, with a complimentary shuttle to the airport and car rental. There is a reasonably priced water-taxi to the City right outside and there is also a T bus to the airport and the underground and a T ferry to the City. The only slight niggle is the $10 a day for the Internet connection and some of the room service charges. However, the room rate is lower than most of the other airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: jlmasters
Reviews.Content: I was only in town for a quick business trip, but the staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful and friendly. A very quick airport pickup and a beautiful view to boot! Breakfast at the restuarant a the hotel was also delicious, and not overpriced as is at many similar locations.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning View of Boston”
Reviews.Author: SandraR2001
Reviews.Content: Good location with a free shuttle bus from the airport. The views from the harbourside rooms are breath taking. We ate in the restaurant / bar and sat outside on the patio which was great as they have table heaters and the view is straight across the water to the financial district. Our food was lovely and quite large size portions (cobb salad and club sandwich)The room was a really good size, decent bathroom and the staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: avid_reviewer1
Reviews.Content: We had a flight delay and had to take a flight following morning from Boston. We had a gorgeous view of the skyline. I ordered room service and it was a tasty quesadilla. The rest of food was average. I do have to say though, that WE DID NOT PAY for our stay. The airline footed the bill for the inconvenience of staying an extra night. So, I cannot comment on expense of room. Still a very lovely experience. Close to airport and they have airport shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “so amazing and right by Logan”
Reviews.Author: jamaica6100
Reviews.Content: Great great location, you can take water taxi to Ptown catamarran or shuttle to MTA, nice outside dining amazing views from high rooms food is OK but at least we could have a decent supper after late flight !

Reviews.Title: “Decent/above average for an airport hotel...”
Reviews.Author: G L
Reviews.Content: For an airport hotel (literally on airport grounds - nothing but airport buildings around), it's pretty good, but that's to be expected of a Hyatt. Excellent locale though: water taxi to downtown Boston is right behind hotel so one can avoid traffic by hopping very inexpensive water taxi directly to downtown. Rooms are nice and if you get one with view of harbor, very nice at night with very large windows...

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: genkhis_khan
Reviews.Content: Smart and comfortable hotel by the airport and with a terrific view of the Boston skyline. Nice eating out area at night. Fairly good food and selection of wine, beer and ales. The nearby water taxi to downtown Boston is convenient and enjoyable. Have stayed here several times now both on business and for pleasure (having flown into Boston en route to New England.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky Start”
Reviews.Author: nnbk
Reviews.Content: Hot, tired....just wanted to take a nap upon arrival. The rollaway bed, which was requested in advance for a third adult, was not in the room. Called the front desk to make them aware. Went out for dinner and a little shopping at Quincy Market, and upon return, found no extra bed. Called the front desk to request the bed again. After waiting one hour and now being 9:30pm, my husband went down to the front desk and this time returned with the hotel manager and a bed, many apologies, and complementary breakfasts for three. We enjoyed the rest of our stay. There are chairs along the waters edge to enjoy the fabulous view of downtown Boston, especially after dark. With the hotel's shuttle service, it makes access to the heart of Boston and airport extremely easy. Despite our rocky start, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Marylandmom13
Reviews.Content: We had very early flights out of Logan so we decided to stay close to the airport and hopefully have some time to explore the city. They offer a free shuttle to the airport or to the T station and there is also a water taxi that allows you easy access to the city. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean and modern. Restaurant was just so, so. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Boston and 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Florida-Dreaming_101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times over the summer for pleasure trips in the city. I can't say enough goods things about this hotel, its staff, and the Hyatt brand. First off, the view of the Boston city skyline from this hotel is STUNNING, especially at night. It is well worth paying the extra for the Harbor View if you are staying longer than just the overnight. The restaurant and grounds all have the same gorgeous view so you can still enjoy if your room is located on the airport side. The grounds are attractive and well maintained and there is a harborside promenade around the property and harbor for those looking for a morning walk or jog. The staff are friendly, courteous, attentive to detail, and go out of their way to make sure your stay is comfortable. As I said, I stayed here several times over the summer. Many staff members even recognized me from my previous stays, greeted me by name, and all treated me like royalty. Even staff that was walking by or in the hallways always had a smile and a friendly hello. The level of service here is top notch and I believe this is the Hyatt philosophy of excellent customer service and making every guest feel special. I ate several meals in the restaurant and found the food to be well prepared and delicious. The menu is not extremely expansive, but they do a nice job otherwise. The morning buffet is especially delightful if you are taking your time and have the opportunity to sit on the patio and take in all the sights. If you book on the Hyatt website, they often have package deals that include the breakfast buffet, which is a really good value. I had two favorite servers, Milton and Yuri, who went above and beyond normal service, but all the staff and hostesses did an excellent job. Want to see the sights and do something in the city? Just ask!! The concierge is ready with suggestions, brochures, will book you a harbor tour or call for a water taxi. Anything you can think of. The water taxis are a great idea to go back and forth across the harbor. I used them the whole stay and never retrieved my car. I mean, what a great concept. You get a boat ride and a cab all in one! Rooms are well appointed and comfortable. Love the beds and toiletries. My only slight complaint would be the level of noise that you can hear in the hallways. One of the reasons I always travel with earplugs. Overall, one of my favorite places to escape it all and relax....and be well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport hotel, but not a four star property for a few reasons...”
Reviews.Author: theepp
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting in the Boston area so I decided to spend the night at a hotel close to the airport. The hotel is beautiful and the views from the water side are rightfully 4 stars, and they rightfully market the hotel's rooms as doing a great job of masking the airport noise. All of these are on the plus side. However, on the down side the walls between the rooms appear to be made of paper. I was awoken this morning to my neighbor's 6am wake-up call, and I am now aware that she has allergies. Every time she sneezed or blew her noise, I heard it as if she were in my room. Also, I had the chance to listen to maintenance work on my other neighbor's phone at 7:35am. Good stuff. Given that, I could probably give it four stars, but if you, like me, needed to utilize the transportation provided by Hyatt to get around the airport, you better set your expectations. It seems as though they have only one bus. I went into the city for dinner last night and took the T back to the airport. From Terminal A, it took 49 minutes from the time I called for the shuttle to the time I got back to the hotel. This morning, I took the shuttle back to the terminal for my flight out and the shuttle stopped at two rental car companies before the terminal. Hint to Hyatt...people getting on your shuttle going to the airport terminal are actually on a schedule. People that are going to the T or to rental car counters are not. Get the priority straight or offer a terminal shuttle. With this experience in mind, I cannot give it four stars. It's a lovely property, but for an airport hotel that is less than one mile from the actual airport, the frustrating shuttle experiences bring down the rating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with some outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: JRK2011
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently completed a 3-night stay (2 â€“ 5 Sep 2011) at Hyatt Harborside in Boston, MA. It was our first time visiting Boston and hotel selection was important. We selected Hyatt Harborside because of its proximity to the Boston harbor. We expected reasonable service and accommodations based on the Hyatt brand. The hotel staff was very courteous, helpful, and professional. The room and other areas of the facility were very appealing and clean. The weather was nice and the harborside view from our room was breathtaking. The convenience of a water taxi stop at the hotelâ€™s harbor was also appreciated and contributed to a wonderful visit of Boston. Of special note and worthy of recognition is the outstanding service (above and beyond what we expected) provided by Hyatt restaurant associates during the evening shift at the hotel restaurant, Harborside Grill. Their pleasant attitude, smiles, attention to details, prompt service, friendly conversation, and much more, made our stay especially enjoyable and memorable. The restaurant manager; Josh Katz, and staff; Milton, Patrick, Vinny, and Dennis made our meals at the Harborside Grill more enjoyable and our overall stay in Boston a success. There was one additional server that waited on us Friday night, but I cannot recall her name. She also provided exceptional service. They more than made up for the poor service we received during our pricey breakfast (adult buffet $25) at the hotel restaurant on Saturday morning. We will definitely stay here on future visits to Boston and highly recommend this location. Thanks again Josh and staff for making this one of our best hotel stays ever.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: NRRGhaven
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. We did not pay for our room to view the city but we were able to walk out along the harbor both in the evening and in the day for photos. The view of the the city was SUPER! We ate at the restaurant for dinner and the food was outstanding. You had to pay extra to park but it was still cheaper than many hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great nights sleep, wonderful views...”
Reviews.Author: Luxtraveller66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first night of our 6 night New England trip after arriving in on a 7pm flight, before collecting our hire car the next morning; and also on our last night in Boston prior to an 8.15am flight home. The last time we stayed here was a few years ago, and knowing how practical the location is for sightseeing and also for flights, we did not hesitate in booking it again for this trip. We did advance purchases on our room and got it for a great rate, and was upgraded to a Harbor View Room on our second night. The terrace serves food, which is OK but not great. Th lobster Mac was a bit bland in taste and my linguini with shrimp was a bit overcooked. BUT the breakfast the next morning from the a la carte menu was superb. I had the Lobster Eggs Benedict, and hubby had the Lobster Omelette. Both were very tasty and beautifully presented and service on both dinner and breakfast was excellent. To be honest, we wished we had gone for something a little more simpler for dinner such as the Fish & Chips, but this was our first night in town and we wanted to try something special. The breakfast buffet was $25pp, and our single dishes were $17 each, plus $4 for juice and $4 for coffee - not cheap, but the breakfast was the best of the trip! The views from rthe terrace (and the Harbor View rooms) of the Boston Skyline are superb and we slept with our curtains open! Staff throughout the hotel from the front desk to the concierge and his staff and the shuttle drivers are extremely friendly and helpful, with the front desk staff remembering me from our stay a few days earlier. To get into town, you can catch the complementary shuttle bus to the T Station, or take the water taxi across to Rowes Wharf (adjacent to the New England Aquarium / 2 blocks from Faneuil Hall). It costs $10pp one way or $17 return. We also went to Antony's Restaurant on Pier 4 on our last night, and a taxi from there cost us $17 via the undeground tunnel. Rooms are comfortable and very quiet - you would not know you were staying at an airport location. The only small niggle is that they do not contain a fridge, but there is an ice-machine in every level. We would not hesitate in staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Chicago Carolin... C
Reviews.Content: We booked this room because it was at Logan and we had a 6 AM flight out. Due to cancellations from Hurricane Irene, we ended up staying at this hotel two days. We were pleased. The view of the city was great. The water taxis were fun. We made it a field trip eating dinner in Boston and felt like tourists. Since our flights were cancelled, we had to work at the hotel. The "business rate" was great - it INCLUDED wifi, all phone calls, and a free breakfast. We were able to do our work with no fees. I wish every business hotel had this. The first night for dinner we were ignored by our waitress. When we spoke with the hostess, she got us a new waiter and gave us our complete dinner for free. Stefanie really turned a bad customer experience into a good one. Typically when I fly out of Boston I stay at the airport Hilton but now the Hyatt is my preference.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property, a little isolated”
Reviews.Author: HoosierCFI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my son. Property was very clean and updated. Staff was friendly, offered recommendations, and provided great assistance. Rooms have views on both sides (harbor view or runway view). Sounds from outside are very muted, however hallway noise seemed to be amplified, as I could hear quiet conversations as if I was standing next to the person in the hallway. Also, the room thermostat didn't seem to keep the room as cool as advertised. Exterior of the property has great landscaping and an amazing view of downtown across the harbor. Food offerings are a little sparse, with one restaurant/bar being offered. Transportation options to/from the hotel are great. Water taxi service is directly at the hotel for $10 per person. There is also the Hyatt shuttle or the Port Authority shuttle to the terminals, the T, or the bus lines. One small thing to note, this seems like this is a large wedding destination on the weekends. I would be wary of staying here on the weekends because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service From The Moment We Arrived”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_200950
Reviews.Content: Great Park & Fly program with the hotel room. We were greated by Brenden from guest services who promptly began to treat us like royalty! He not only escorted us to our room with luggage, but went way out of his way to give us suggestions on fun things to do that night. He was great. Rooms were clean and well appointed. We had a great view of the harbor. Shuttle was right on time. Only complaint was the restaurant. Food was not prepared to our request in the evening and room service in the AM was cold by the time it arrived.

Reviews.Title: “solid stay”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: I arrived just after Hurricane Irene blew through, and the hotel staff were warm and welcoming. My reservation was in order, and when the breakfast order card was missing from my room, the gentleman at the front desk personally delivered one to my room after midnight! The room was comfortable and clean, and I slept very well for about 5 hours before I had to get going to catch my next flight. I wasn't bothered by any external noise, but the hotel builders must have run out of their soundproofing budget once they finished the exterior shell. This hotel has incredibly noisy room doors, and if I'd been trying to sleep in, I would definitely have been disturbed by their banging and clanking. Door replacement needs to go to the top of the retrofit list for the first round of renovations at this property. Room service breakfast was tasty, exactly as ordered, and delivered on time. If the room doors weren't so noisy, I'd have given the place five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Canuck4454
Reviews.Content: Stranded traveller at the Logan Airport. Picked from a dozen hotels not really knowing what to expect. Shuttle service was quick. Check in was smooth and easy. Room was bigger than planned with the most up to date amenities. Overall a great hotel and would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, Customer Service, and Hotel Simply Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: mikie666
Reviews.Content: I read a few reviews about noise, and was a little concerned...you know...no matter where some people stay, I'm convinced they'll NEVER be satisfied. They should just hang themselves now and get it over with. This hotel, and especially the people that operate it - from housekeeping and maintenance to hotel management and everyone in between - are absolutely fantastic. Helpful, considerate, humble, and always ready and willing to help a guest with anything! You will be hard-pressed to find better service and people anywhere. The views are fabulous, and...the piece-de-resistance...so quiet one could hear a pin drop. Even though it's not downtown, I am delighted to sacrifice a tiny little bit of convenience for all of the benefits I know this hotel and its staff deliver! Thanx for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Boston views like no other”
Reviews.Author: adventure_travels
Reviews.Content: Located next to Logan airport, the view of downtown Boston over the water from the hotel can't be beat. Just a short water taxi ride gets you downtown, and free airport shuttles get you to the airport, which you can't hear despite bordering on the runway. I have stayed twice now, and will contine to use it when flying in and ouy of Boston to enjoy those spectacular views. I will however opt out of the restaurant for dinner given that there are much better options just across the water via a nice water taxi ride. Note that on my value rating, I do have a corporate rate I enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: whitaker1956
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We changed plans and decided to stay at the hotel for dinner and I'm glad we did. Delicious food, good wine, and even music on the patio by the fire pits. In the morning the water taxi picks you up right out front within minutes of your call. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT the Hyatt experience!”
Reviews.Author: RandyRandy
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Harborside is a very nice property located adjacent to Boston Logan Airport, directly across the bay from downtown Boston. The views from the bay-front patio are spectacular! We were there for a long weekend with friends to visit the sights and see some of our nation's history. Upon arrival at Logan, we called for the shuttle from the courtesy phone near baggage claim. They told us 20 minutes or less, turned out to be 2 phone calls and more like 40 minutes later. When trying to check in we had arrived too early and our rooms were not available, not a problem, as we had indeed arrived too early. We decided to have breakfast in the restaurant, which was a mistake. Cold food, no service, had to ask twice for our coffee to be refilled before just walking over to the wait-station ourselves and getting a carafe to fill our own cups. Water finally arrived after 3 requests. We were given 1 frozen pat of butter for 2 orders of toast and an English muffin. Our experience at the restaurant was mostly terrible during our stay, with the exception of 2 bright stars, Edna (from London) and Dennis (from Russia). While there were other service failures and oversights during our stay, the worst failure came from housekeeping. We returned from a day of sightseeing to find our room had been left open all day! Apparently the housekeeper had turned the lock to prevent the door from closing all the way while they were cleaning up. It was never turned back and our door remained open the rest of the day, with a MacBook Pro and two Kindles left out in the open. Luckily the guests on our floor were honest and nothing was missing. This type of mistake is inexcusable! The room itself, with its king bed, was clean, comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. The hotel itself is very nice, but the Hyatt Corporation needs to come in and so some personnel housekeeping of its own!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms, can't sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Clp3333
Reviews.Content: I woke up several times due to noise. The front desk was in no way helpful and had no fans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a night at the airport -- Quiet, comfortable, great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: familyinnh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, comfortable hotel a 5 minute shuttle ride from the terminal. Stayed overnight before an early morning flight with my family and it was great. Service was exceptional. Nothing bad to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, fine stay”
Reviews.Author: shawbee99
Reviews.Content: After my flight was delayed, delayed and finally cancelled I was able to get one of the last rooms available at this hotel for an unexpected stay. The airport shuttle was around to pick me up in around 10 minutes after calling. Walking into the lobby the first thing you notice is the fantastic view of the Boston skyline. The rooms were well appointed, but no mini bar. Room service was quick as was service at the lobby bar. Prices were high, but to be expected when the hotel has a captive audience. There is nothing else within walking distance to this place. Check out was quick and the shuttle left almost immediately. Overall its not my preferred BOS airport hotel but the views are great and its a fine place to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ynca
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Hyatt Harborside, which has the best location of any airport hotel I've used - wonderful views of the Boston skyline, and easy access via water taxi which is always a quirky and fun way to get around. The Hyatt itself is fine, rooms are a decent size with all the usual business amenities. Breakfast buffet was a little limited and when items ran out, they were slow to replenish. Short order breakfast service was very slow and not in line with a business hotel. Staff were helpful enough but not as friendly as I have encountered elsewhere in the US - a little brusque, very tip-conscious (hanging around waiting for tips) which I don't usually find in the US. I was not asked on checking out if I had any problems during my stay, which I found unusual. The problems I had were laundry left in on time took 2 days to get back, and standard of housekeeping was not great (room was not vacuumed properly). Overall, the hotel was fine and I'd stay there again for the location, but I'd give myself a good hour for breakfast to overcome the delays, and be better prepared with lots of dollar bills for all the tipping that seems to be expected on every interaction with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic View of Boston Harbor”
Reviews.Author: MacAtlantaGa_
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hyatt Harborside a number of times over the past two years and it has become one my favorites. It is located on the airport property with a direct view across the harbor to downtown Boston. Two things I love about this hotel property. During the summer and early fall, have breakfast outside on the terrace watching the sun rise over the Boston Harbor, or have a drink and watch the sun set in the evening. Second, there is a water taxi located right at the hotel, which is fun way to get into downtown...especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mahoward15
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the staff could not be more helpful. The shuttle took us to and from the subway station and only took about five minutes each time. The only negative aspect of our stay was the couple next door to us...they were very loud! We were exhausted from driving and going to the Red Sox game, the couple was up late and up early. The price for this beautiful hotel is truly a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis After Travel Torture”
Reviews.Author: coolbreezewingtips
Reviews.Content: My wife and year-old daughter stayed here on a Friday and Saturday night recently. We had had a terribly long day of travel with several flight delays, and were completely exhausted when we arrived at Boston's Logan International Airport. How relieved we were to arrive at the Hyatt and be treated so well by the professional staff. I explained how difficult our day was going and received an on-the-spot room upgrade for no extra charge. Our room was spacious, clean, quiet, and had a fabulous view of Boston Harbor and the city skyline. We greatly enjoyed the breakfast buffet the next morning, which we ate out on the veranda facing the Harbor. If you are a weary traveler, especially with family in tow, look no further than the airport; stay at the Hyatt, and you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fine sendoff from Boston”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller2
Reviews.Content: Maybe I just haven't done enough research but Boston's Logan Airport seems terribly lacking in decent restaurants. So wife and I, returning from Boston on a recent vacation, decided to check in our big bags early, then head off for a few hours to the nearby Hyatt Harborside--there's a free MBTA shuttle bus--to sit out by the harbor and then have a pre-flight meal. The shuttle runs frequently and you can easily catch it back to your Terminal in time for takeoff. This proved to be an excellent decision and I recommend it to other travellers to Boston. The view out over the harbor from the hotel grounds is great, as is the view from the dining room itself. My wife pronounced her clam chowder the best she has had in Boston and my fish and chips were splendid, especially enjoyed the lemony tartar sauce accompanying. Nice selection of local beers and wife loved her dessert choice. Service was friendly and efficient. Prices most reasonable for a hotel dining room. What more to ask?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently suprised.”
Reviews.Author: shsdawg
Reviews.Content: Nice place. It's a bit out of the way but that is the ONLY knock I could find on it. The service was great. The food was outstanding. The view on the harborside was incredible. I will definately stay here again when back in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: tj722
Reviews.Content: Very nice property. My room had a view of the airport runways. No problem with noise, was able to sleep just fine. I took a $10 water taxi into the city - the boats queue up right next to the hotel. Although the hotel is literally next to the terminals, you still need to take their courtesy shuttle to the airport. They were a bit disorganized the morning I stayed there - one of their shuttles broke down and it took a while for them to get the backup going. I was pretty early so I still was able to make my flight. So pad your schedule accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine!”
Reviews.Author: mrswh
Reviews.Content: I had booked this property with Hyatt points, but after reading some of the more recent reviews I was nervous. It turned out just fine! The airport shuttle was not a problem - a few minutes to the train or airport, and got picked up at the airport within 5 minutes of calling. The view of Boston and the harbor really is outstanding from the lobby, restaurant, and half of the guest rooms (including ours). If you can get an upgrade, take it! I didn't hear any airport noise in the least - very quiet other than the occasional honking of the water taxi arriving. There is, however, a noise problem from within the hotel. Loud, loud hallways, doors slamming - you can hear it all. I do think this is a common problem for hotels in general, especially when they are close to capacity. The rooms are HUGE (you could easily fit two rollaways in a king room if you wanted). True there are no towel racks but there are shelves - worked fine for me. Strange, we had connecting rooms and while one had a bath/shower combo, the other had only a shower. If a bath tub is something important you might want to request it specifically. Our connecting door wouldn't stay open so I called the desk - they answered immediately and another staff member brought two door stops in 10 minutes. Rooms are clean and nicely furnished. Yes, the shower grout had a little bit of something yucky - mold? - but it was overall very clean. The carpet looked pretty new. We ate dinner at the restaurant (Harborside Grill). It has beautiful views and the server was very nice but S-L-O-W. There were 4 errors with our meal (for 4 people), and while she apologized profusely, it still took quite a while to resolve them all. The food is fine - not terrific but not bad at all. Above average. It is expensive, but at least the kids' meals are somewhat reasonable. Front desk staff were pleasant. We arrived at 3:30 and only one of our rooms was ready. (A little annoying given that check-in is supposed to be a 3:00.) They gave us the key to the one that was ready, called housekeeping to let them know it was a priority, and within 15 minutes the gentleman from the front desk knocked on our door with the keys to the connecting room. We stayed here on the way home from a trip to Narragansett as we had an early morning flight out of BOS. I would definitely stay here again in the same situation. If I wanted to be in the city, I'd stay at the Hotel Commonwealth!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy”
Reviews.Author: HKChicago
Reviews.Content: Late flight in and planning to leave early the next morning. Waited 30-45 mins for the shuttle which came only after three phone calls to the desk. Room was excessively noisy. At 3:45am drunk customer knocked on several doors including mine before finding his room next door. Waited again for the shuttle (15 mins) and the driver dropped me at incorrect terminal for my international flight. AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful with mostly nice personnel”
Reviews.Author: rpmcestmoi
Reviews.Content: Great van drivers, great view, nice help. Noisy air conditioning, plugged toilet that took four calls to be fixed by a very nice maintenance man. A generally worn bathroom with no towel racks and not a watersaving toilet. Nice but ridiculously priced lunch and dinner menu. Really nice servers at breakfast. Pay 9.95 per day for wi-fi (how bush is that) but still really nice restaurant personnel, concierge and van personnel. The fish rots from the head. This corporation is very inconsistent and we are really annoyed with this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but terrible to reach.”
Reviews.Author: Jubbin55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 days as part of a group attending a conference in the Boston Convention Center. The hotel is bang next to the Airport and there is a courtesy shuttle which will pick you up if you call the front desk. The hotel has a great location at opposite the Boston harbor front. The views from the room is incredible. The rooms are large and immaculate, The bed is great and the amenities in the room is great The Breakfast at the Harbour grill was great. The only drawbacks. Difficult to get to Downtown Boston. The options include 1. Catching the Silver line and getting of the Airport terminal and calling for the courtesy coach 2.
