Catch the Metro Blue line to the airport and call for the courtesy coach 3. Take a water taxi to the Logan Airport Jetty which is bang next to the Hotel ( costs $10) 4. Take a taxi which can be expensive on the journey to Downtown Boston because of the tolls ($28-30) and cheaper when getting to the hotel ($20) which maybe the only option after 10pm dinner in town. Internet cost $ 10 a night but is available Meals are expensive in the hotel and you miss out on all the great options in Downtown Boston if you eat at the hotel but finding you way back after a great meal in town is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed, will not come back.”
Reviews.Author: Jmo11
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I stayed here for 7 days in May of 2011 for my best friend's wedding. The wedding ceremony/reception was at the hotel. Other than the actual wedding reception our time there was horrible. From the moment we checked in to the moment we left it was a struggle. The wedding party was placed all over the hotel, none of us were near each other, which i can understand if we all showed up but these rooms and the wedding were booked months in advance. The service at the hotel bar/restaurant was lacking. It took like what seemed forever to get anybody to look in your direction to place an order, and it took even longer to get that order. Mind you this was not a crowed place. There were maybe 20 people there and 15 of them were with us. The overall customer service was abysmal. Other than the Bell Hops, nobody was friendly. The Bride and Groom were never meant to feel special by anybody even the wedding coordinator. We had an issue at breakfast where we were overcharged and the food tasted terrible and the manager told us the best he could do was take 1 meal off. When we asked him if we could get the whole bill comped because none of us ate anything he stopped short of laughing at us. it wasn't until the groom to be informed him of how much business we were bringing him this weekend that he took care of the $75 bill. Now I understand that this is a hotel at an airport and maybe they aren't used to accommodating guests that stay for more than 2 days but if you advertise your hotel as a great wedding spot then I beg you to please have staff that is able to make the guests feel welcomed. I am originally from Boston and this was my first trip back since moving away and if it was not for the wedding being at this hotel we would not have stayed here. If at all possible when you are in Boston stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “It's not AT all worth your money: A true WASTE"”
Reviews.Author: qopgirl10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hyatt haborside and we were DISGUSTED. It first took 40 minutes to check in becuase they are so incompetent. ridiculous. Then we decided we would check out the pool while we waited... DISGUSTING. There were footprints at the bottom of the pool from the slime and green mold built up in the pool that obviously wasn't being cleaned. The service was horrible. They don't seem to care about helping at all. The restaurant was RIDICULOUS. Maybe they're used to business trips where you can "write off" the check, but for a normal, average family, it was RIDICULOUS. Breakfast cost us $25 a person, when my daughter literally ate eggs and toast? Having a drink at the hotel at night was also going to cost you an arm and a leg. My daughter got a NON ALOCHOLIC lemonade and it cost me $9. The showers had mold growing and was changing colors. There is no fridge, no safe, and barely curtains in the rooms. The experience was horrible all the way around. The ONLY part we appreciated and enjoyed was the free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay. Beautiful view.”
Reviews.Author: ChiFT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for a conference at the hotel. Really really like this hotel. Friendly, well decorated, well maintained, clean, spacious. I wish it is in downtown, but of course it is an airport hotel. A few details: - Room - Great. bright, airy, spacious, comfortable, well maintained, well decorated, good bed, good working space, good comfortable bed, good wifi-and wired access, good airconditioning system (which responds to the temperature control!), good shower, .... . Only thing - would love to have a fridge to keep my drinks cold and a safe to have a bit more peace of mind when leaving laptop, blackberry etc in the room. But no problem. Its is an airport hotel and my room faces the airport, but I couldnt hear anyplane noise at all - insulation is brilliant. - View - half the rooms in teh hotel face the airport, east facing and ideal for plane-spotters, and half the rooms face teh harbour and downtown Boston, west facing and beautiful view. Unfortunately I got one of the rooms on the airport side, - Harbourside grill - I had breakfast here for three mornings and a dinner as well. Delicious Crab Cake Benedict. Reasonable buffet. Good waffles although they didnt have whipped cream that morning (?). Full breakfast buffet for $25 which I think is on the expansive side. Continental for $16, which still seem a bit expensive. but desont bother me too much and this is similar price to others Hyatt's I have stayed elsewhere. - Location - The view of Boston downtown across the harbour is to die for. In fact, the veiw is listed in Top 10 Boston guidebook as one of the top views in Boston. The drawback is, downtown is across the harbour. The pier for Water Taxi to go to downtown is right outside the hotel but costs $10 single, which I think is expensive. Alternatively, the hotel has free shuttle bus to the airport from where one can take the silver line metro/bus. This option is much cheaper but takes longer. - Staff - They are friendly and helpful. Having just stayed in a hotel for two days in NYC where the staff are really not friendly and reluctant to help, it is so good to stay somewhere where the staff are friendly - from check in desk staff, to restaurant staff, to consierge, to cleaning staff. Great. Concierge staff are very knowledgeable too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms with fantastic view and great staff”
Reviews.Author: srogers01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Harborside for one night following a flight cancellation. Upon arrival, I had no luggage whatsoever and I asked the front desk for some toiletries (i.e. toothbrush, toothpaste etc). They told me they would be sent to my room but they never arrived. Despite this, the room was beautiful and I had an amazing view of the harbor. However, I had trouble sleeping at night as I could hear people in the hallway talking/opening/closing doors. It got to be a little frustrating by 1am. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle that will take you pretty much anywhere you need to go (within reason of course). The staff were extremely friendly, especially the morning staff which greeted me as I left the hotel at 4am to catch my flight. The room service was also great - good food, just very expensive. Overall I had a pleasant experience at this hotel. I just wish they had provided me with some necessities as my luggage had left Boston without me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: jbmoberly
Reviews.Content: The service and cleanliness was excellent. The shuttle ran frequently to either the airport or the T. The hotel employees, including the shuttle drivers, were very friendly and helpful. I didn't realize I had dropped my wallet on the shuttle when we were going downtown. When we returned the shuttle driver was waiting for me outside the hotel to give it to me. It had my credit cards, money & driver's license in it. Losing my wallet could have made my trip and unhappy one . Instead the caring & honesty of this employee made it a memorable one. We would certainly stay there when we go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for easy access to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: LondonSunseeker22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really close to the airport and offers agree shuttle bus to the airport, car rental and the T stop. The view across the bay is spectacular and for plane spotters, the rooms at the rear provide unparalleled views of the runways. Parking is outrageously priced at $34 per day! There are better value hotels in Boston but for easy access to the airport this is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “OMG -The Views!”
Reviews.Author: KK50HHC
Reviews.Content: What a gem Hyatt has at Logan airport. The Hyatt Harborside is by far the best airport hotel I have stayed at in years of travel. Hotel is in great condition, restaurant / bar is hopping with people and the patio serves food and drink as you overlook Boston from the water. Easy trip downtown via a water taxi (cheap too) and a fun expience. All the other Logan airport hotels are just that - a boring airport hotel. The Hyatt is more like a destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Adam_in_the_UK
Reviews.Content: During my trip to Boston I stayed in the 3 hotels. This was the last and was only overnight as we had an early flight. What a shame. The view (we had a harbour view) was spectacular and the service was everything you could hope for in a Hyatt. Well done

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and accommodating staff-you should stay here”
Reviews.Author: Fa-HEE-tahs
Reviews.Content: The hotel had caught my eye because of the view of the harbor I had seen in pictures. It was even more amazing when I arrived. The hotel staff is very accommodating, from the GM to the shuttle driver, all very nice and pleasant. The concierge was of great help also, saving me money by recommending the train into the city instead of paying 10 dollars for the water taxi. I never had an issue with the shuttle, given the amount of runs it makes between terminals, grocery, train and hotel. My longest wait was maybe six minutes coming from the train station. The views on either side of the hotel are beautiful, so either room is a great choice. Noise outside of the hotel was very minimal, with the exception of the ferry horn that goes off whenever it leaves. The room was very clean and organized, bathroom nice and tidy also. I found no real quips with this hotel at all. I have found my place to stay when I visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, unless you MUST be near the airport”
Reviews.Author: bosenose
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing experience; they overbooked king beds, so my girlfriend and I were stuck with 2 double beds. My travel companions had the same experience. I had to fight for complimentary wi-fi access to compensate (something that should be free for a $250/nt room anyways) and were offered the privilege of upgrading to a suite for an additional $150. Our room had some dated/low rent aspects (eg. bathroom door handle kept falling off). As others have said, VERY poor sound insulation (could hear every word of conversations in adjacent rooms and in the hallway). Re: location, it is close to the airport, but the tedium of taking a shuttle to the metro vs. a pricey cab ride every day was a major pain. Don't give in to the high prices for food they charge...walk over to East Boston from the Airport metro stop and get some great ethnic food. I must say that the staff were very courteous and helpful, and the view was indeed impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Never staying here again”
Reviews.Author: lucinda88420
Reviews.Content: Next time we will stay in the city. The only good thing about our stay was the beautiful view of the city. We heard every word of our neighbors and people walking through the hallways, which woke us up both mornings. The breakfast was WAY over priced and the waitress got 2 aspects of our order wrong. There was NO MENTION at check in about parking charges. They told us " take a ticket and the concierge will take care of it at checkout." We got slapped with an extra $70 charge for 2 night of parking! In addition to the $500 we spent there! I tried to talk to 2 different employees about it, and no one was willing to help or reduce the cost. Traveling into the city was easiest by water taxi, but was $10 each way per person. When we decided to take the subway, the free hotel van to bring us there took the long way..... stopping at each airport terminal in Saturday night traffic. He did not tell us we were going to have to go this way, which took 20 minutes instead of 3 minutes.... and made us 30 minutes late for the show we were going to!! We will NEVER stay here again. It's not even close to being worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: allyn206
Reviews.Content: Yes,its next to Logan airport. That may be the only negative thing I could come up with. And that's only because I wasn't flying! I was pleasantly surprised with every aspect of my stay, and I mean everything. From front desk to room service staff, this was probably my top two hotel experience in my life. I firmly believe that in any travel experience the people servicing you will make or break that experience. And this hotels entire staff and accommodations made my weekend. Thanks hyatt! Homerun

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for night before flight”
Reviews.Author: stephanier76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my significant other the night before an early morning flight. It was very convenient for the purpose. Upon our arrival we were greeted by a pleasent gentleman who gave us a few bits of info on the shuttle for the airport folllowing morning and suggested a wake up call also. Check in was smooth and easy. We were placed in a room with a king bed but was handicap accesible which was not a problem. We were on the airport side which I found to be fun to watch planes that we couldnt hear at all. Unfortunately we forgot to eat before our arrival and had to eat in the hotel restaurant which was a bit pricey (but hey its a hotel) and I was pleasantly surprised with the large size of my chowdah bowl. Our waitress was a little akward with her inquiring after I ordered my chowdah and my boyfriend ordering a salad..."is that really it?". Um yeah it was almost 10 pm and was just informed they were closing the restaurant at 10. Just struck me as odd. The bed was extremey comfortable, room size spacious.On time wake up call, check out smooth and shuttle at the ready and got us right to our terminal. All in all a great stay. My one suggestion-in the shower in the handicap room move the metal shelf from the wall where you step in. It sticks out a little far and I struck myself on it twice while in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully accommodating people!”
Reviews.Author: elevenx2
Reviews.Content: We were flying out in the morning and had planned to stay one night at this hotel (repeat customers). Everyone was totally welcoming, especially to our 4 year old, with both Carmen and Megan sending milk and cookies to the room before bedtime. Then AA cancelled our flight and we couldn't fly out until the following day. The staff suggested things for us to do and were really all positive and great. The driver on the shuttle bus most helpfully steered us to the subway and the aquarium. Lim, Milton, Carlos and Derek all went out of the way to pay attention to our son and keep him happy. We have always found this hotel a pleasant and relaxing stop before a morning flight the next day but they really rose to the occasion, making the day spent there part of our vacation rather than a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this property”
Reviews.Author: Sanddog332003
Reviews.Content: I booked this propery via Priceline and the discount was not that much. Actually it was not worth the "savings". While the property is convenient to the airport, there were multiple problems with the bathroom, clogged drain in the tub (I showered in ankle deep water) and a toilet that was not secure to the floor. Also, the walls are paper thin and the loud kids/parents next door were so loud they woke us up before sunrise. The staff was not accomodating and I do not recommend this hotel whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - Parking Discount information”
Reviews.Author: VernonCT
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on Tripadvisor before booking and I have to say that they are pretty much correct. We really enjoyed this property. First of all, it was easy to find ( good signage is important - getting lost in Boston would not have made for a fun night ). Secondly, like others have said, the noise - proofing here is GREAT. I would not have known planes were taking off and landing if not for my daughter pointing them out! The staff here was fantastic. I have to say that I felt that they went above and beyond to accomodate their guests. The check in process went very smoothly and everyone ( staff wise ) that we encountered was very pleasant and helpful. With regard to the comments on the parking sitution ( $32/night for overnight parking which I agree that I feel is a lot for guests ) so I called the Guest Services and they mentioned that as a AAA member, parking is $16. That is a more reasonable rate for guests ( free would still be nice ) but I was glad that I checked on that and hopefully someone else can make good use of this information. :) We used the pool and the fitness center and both were nice. The hotel was clean and the room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Can't ask for much more! Would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “STUNNINGLY BEAUTIFUL HOTEL AND VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: Matt_1990
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Harborside Boston, on Sunday January 16th, before I was due to fly home to London early on the Monday morning. I booked the hotel, last minute, directly on the Hyatt website. I arrived at the hotel, to be greeted by check in staff, and showed to my room. The view? Stunning. I was in room 615, overlooking downtown boston. The room looked directly over the estuary with passing boats. At nigh time, the skyline was illuminated like something from a movie. I even slept with the curtains open to lie and look at the city. The price was around $230 which I guess is around Â£190. I ordered room service and paid a one-day internet access fee $9. When I checked out, (at 4am) there was plenty of hotel staff around, wishing me "Good Morning!" wherever I went. I was simply asked if I wanted the room billed to my Mastercard. (The total cost of the room+ room service was around $260 for one night) and my own Hyatt car was awaiting to take me to the airport terminal. Such an enjoyable end to my trip. What a beautiful Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...and what a view of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked via Otel.com for 170$ (ouch).Check in was top notch, very friendly, making you feel important. They gave me a room with a view of the Harbah'. Room was classy and comfie, first class accommodations, LCD TV, beautiful bathroom, free internet provided given I'm a Hyatt Gold member. Nice gym and pool available. Easy access to water taxi and public transit. Left early so didn't use restaurants (pricey).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views and large room”
Reviews.Author: JetSet-Q
Reviews.Content: The staff at the desk left a bit to be desired, however the bellboys were great - very friendly. The views is what it's all about for this hotel, you just can't beat the view! The transfers took a while, but got the job done. The location is annoying for anything other than transits, as it can be troublesome to get to the city. The room service took forever, and got most of it wrong first time around.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Dandy, but One Serious Flaw”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: Winter weather grounded us in Boston unexpectedly for the night. With a late arrival and planned early departure, we decided to stay right at the airport. We had enjoyed the Harborside Hyatt very much the last time we were stranded, so anticipated a good stay. We received a nice welcome and the room, albeit on the airport side instead of the water side, was lovely and well-kept. Unfortunately we found the internal soundproofing on this floor (4th) to be severely lacking. Noise from adjoining rooms and the hallways was easily heard. No one was being obnoxious; they were just conversing or going about their 3:50 am departure. A well designed, well built hotel would muffle these to-be-expected sounds adequately. Consequently this time we have to give sleep quality a "poor" and if there is a next time, ask if there are better insulated areas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an early/late flight”
Reviews.Author: spazgirl
Reviews.Content: This is my second one night stay at this airport either getting an early flight the next morning or coming in on a late flight. This time we got an upgraded room which was quite large, clean and comfortable. Also had a great view of Boston. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Rummus151
Reviews.Content: The good, the hotel is pretty nice and well located. The view is just plain spectacular. The room was clean and neat but the decoration is kind of bland. The bad, staff is extremely rude and uptight. Is a business hotel but not the kind that makes stuff easy for you after a long flight or day at the office? That day was snowing and it took them for ever to clean the walkway to the parking lot which brings me to the ugly and believe me is uglyâ€¦â€¦$32 a night for the parking lot. No special rate for guests and if you ask why they will roll their eyes and ask you to check the parking rates in downtown Boston and compare. I know the Parking lot belongs to the airport but come onâ€¦â€¦ play some defense for the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, and QUIET!”
Reviews.Author: jwolfgang9
Reviews.Content: i was fearing my stay at this hotel, due to it's location on the airport property. but it was very well insulated, so there was no aircraft noise in the rooms at all. Quite a remote location. Nice walking trails alongside the harbor, leading to a neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view onto Boston across the water”
Reviews.Author: usuallyhappytravels
Reviews.Content: An overall pleasant hotel very close to the airport. Either get their shuttle or use the free public transport from the airport to the water taxi (line #66). The dock is right next to the hotel. For return to the airport, if in a hurry take the hotel shuttle, bus#66 stops at some parking lots before going to all terminals. The rooms were well equipped, house keeping honored my 'do not disturb' sign without leaving extra voicemails. Very comfortable bed. Added room feature bonus: a travel-size tube of toothpaste is part of the amenities. Restaurant very good with perfect views across the water to downtown. Both hotel and food are slightly on the pricey side. This location is away from downtown, either the water taxi (18$ one way) or public transport (~3$ but 45minutes) get you across. Walk along the waterside is OK, monument nearby. However, no shops or restaurants. Perfect proximity to airport though. If no luggage, it is walkable. Check-in was a little slow, check-out very speedy.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views, delicious food, wonderful staff, delightful!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingThom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling to Salem, Mass. for all the fun Halloween happenings. We live in RI and decided to stay in Boston overnight. What a great stay with spectacular Boston skyline and harbor views from the restaurant and our room. A little pricey but what you would expect from a 4 star Boston hotel. Had dinner, drinks and the morning breakfast buffet-all good and ample portions. Service is friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Everything A la Carte”
Reviews.Author: taxdefender
Reviews.Content: Got this Hotel on Priceline probably could have done better if I waited until closer to the date. Parking, internet, business center, continental breakfst all carry additional charges. Only fitness center is included. You also have the added tolls getting to and from town. Walls a little thin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: kcchefsfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Harborside before an early morning flight out of Logan airport. The rooms were good sized, comfortable, and well equipped. The staff was excellent. They greeted us in the driveway of the hotel and helped take our bags to the room (we had a lot of bags). The baggage service desk also helped to find us an old bag to use when we realized that our bags were way over-weight. The shuttle driver was friendly and also helped us with our bags. Check-in and check-out were simple. The computers were down during check-out, but they emailed they invoice a few hours later. Overall, it was an excellent stay. I would definitely stay here again when passing through Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with many hidden fees.”
Reviews.Author: AandJTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, and the staff is friendly, however, we have a few things to warn people about. WARNINGS: A) When we arrived to our room, it had just been "hot boxed" with Marijuana! The smell was SO strong, I instantly had a headache. I have no idea how the cleaning person who was just down the hall from our room didn't smell it while cleaning (unless they were the one to do it!). The man helping us with our bags knew it too and quickly got us a new room (which smelled like cigerettes). We took it because it was apparently the only other Harbourside room. The only offer we got for the "inconvienent check-in" was "free parking" which should be free anyways in my opinion. This hotel is a money trap in my opinion. I was scared to look at something too closely and accidently getting charged for it. Huge disappointment for the average rate of this place. B) The parking is over $30 for overnight. C) The water bottles are $5 in the rooms and would normally cost just over $1 at a conveience store. D) They DO NOT have free wi-fi. And the "free" internet on the TV is slow, and extremely annoying E) They do not offer many TV stations for free. There are about 12 stations. Positive feedback: A) It's beautiful B) The staff is friendly C) Great view of the Harbour D) Comfy bed E) Clean

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Stay”
Reviews.Author: OhmanBozeman
Reviews.Content: My husband, toddler, and I recently stayed here and it was a great place. We had a million dollar view of Boston from our Harbor side room, at an AWESOME family rate. (You have to request it). The room was very posh and comfortable. Our daughter could not get enough of the glass elevator rides with views of the airport. Outside the back of the hotel is a great Harbor walk that leads you to a wonderful outdoor public park, or you can catch a water taxi into the city. The only thing to note is that there are NO amenities nearby. So, unless you want to eat in the hotel's restaurant (which is pretty good but pricey) there are no other options for food, drink, snacks... We would definitely stay here again and spend more time on their back porch in front of their gas fireplaces with a drink from their well stocked bar, looking at the great view of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “loved it..perfect location for us..but then again i LOVE airports!!”
Reviews.Author: saintaine
Reviews.Content: staff were very friendly. great shuttle bus service to and from subway and airport. Hotel and rooms were immaculate. the view of the harbour from the restaurant is amazing. faults--could literally watch no channels on the television for free. --bottled water in the room was $5

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms with a nice city view”
Reviews.Author: travelinggringo
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night when our other hotel overbooked and shipped us over to the Hyatt. Once finally checked in (after a few attempts) we found the rooms small, but clean. We had a great view of the city. It was tight for our family of four, but we were only there one night. I think if we would have been there more than one night we would have been unhappy. Beds weren't overly comfortable, but the hotel was quiet. We arrived very late and we left first thing in the morning - so no idea on the cost of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but awkward location”
Reviews.Author: 2islandhoppers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the airport, and shuttle buses run 24 hrs/day to/from the airport and transit system into the city. However, unless you are prepared to journey into the city (and it is a 'journey'), you are stuck paying their outrageous prices for meals. It was so expensive we decided to forego entrees, and stuck with $16 appies and a glass of wine. My calamari was so overcooked, it was only recognizable as crunchy fried strips. On the positive side, although we booked with Hotwire we were placed in a 15th floor harbor view room. There was no noise from the hotel exterior, but the corridors and rooms had paper thin walls and you could hear all conversations from neighbors and halls. There is an additional charge for parking and WiFi use. The hotel is convenient if you need an overnight before a flight, but for vacationing/sightseeing in Boston, the location is fairly isolated and you need to be prepared to take transit into the city. The rate I got through Hotwire was exceptional, otherwise this would not have been my first choice for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “NEED'S BETTER MANAGEMENT !!!”
Reviews.Author: steve1boston
Reviews.Content: this trip was a bit more pleasant than the last one i had 2 months ago but there was one thing i found very strange was employees complaining about there employer, this made me feel very odd! this is one example, we got a ride on the "courtesy shuttle" and the employee in the afternoon shift was going on an and about how bad his job is and that he never gets tip's and he was worth more. This to me is a sign that the employee should go else where cause a rotten piece of fruit can rot out the rest of the fruit. Management needs to better get involved with the guest and mostly the employees

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Value - but only for Lots & Lots of Money!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayHappy29
Reviews.Content: We went to our yearly reunion here tentatively - the most expensive hotel we've used in 28 years. Immediately, we were hit with additional fees for parking ($32/day!), the Cartoon Channel, internet access, and it went downhill from there. A room service English Muffin would cost $17, by the time all of the fees (including butter) were added. Sandals left at the pool went missing within 5 minutes. While the hotel is gorgeous, with many amenities, each one of them came with a price. The scenic restaurant had an outdoor patio to die for - especially when the skunks appeared! We could only recommend this embarrassingly expensive hotel to someone who makes $250K/year or over, with a great 401k plan.

Reviews.Title: “Prison food is better than the meals served here!”
Reviews.Author: tiki_touring
Reviews.Content: This year business trips have seen me staying at a number of Hyatt hotels around the country and had clocked up enough for a free night. So I was looking forward to a weekend of sightseeing in Boston and to use the free night at this Hyatt. There are pros and cons with the hotels location being on the Airport side of the harbor. The downside is you will need to take a water taxi ($17/return) across the harbor or drive to get back over to the city and parking is $32/night. The upside is that you have a waterfront location with views across the harbor towards the city which are just beautiful at night. Upon check in I asked for a harbor side room and was rewarded with one - thank you. After a busy day sightseeing around Boston my wife and I decided to use the hotel restaurant for supper....what a mistake. First off this is not a white tablecloth restaurant, it would be nice if it was as the tablecloths would cover the dirty table tops that need a good scrub to clean the food from them. Next observation is why are the wait staff wearing McDonald's restaurant uniforms? Staff wearing blue short sleeve shirts that look like they have never been pressed. C'mon Hyatt what about clean pressed white shirts for staff? Then finally my entree (the tuna at $32) was delivered....what a shocker a tuna steak slapped onto a mash of over boiled spinach and sliced baby potatoes. My wife's chicken something meal was just as bad. Both meals looked like what they would dish up at a prison. McDonald's does a better job with meal presentation! Did a I mention that the rooms have large flat panel TVs that only receive basic analog cable ~ 12 channels....no NECN for New England sports to watch !!! What type of hotel is this when they charge over $239/night? Would I sleep hear again - not if I can help it. Would I eat here again - no.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the skunks on the patio!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingManSpokane
Reviews.Content: First the review, then the skunk story. We stayed at this hotel twice on both ends of an east coast college scouting trip. We had Room 1011 (Harbor View King) connecting to Room 1009 (Harbor view two doubles). The rooms were modern and comfortable, but the air conditioning definitely makes a lot of noise at night. We chose this hotel specifically to be close to the airport after a long, cross country flight into Boston and to be close to the airport for an early morning return flight. As far as location goes, you can't get much closer to the airport than this, unless you're staying at the Hilton. To some reviewers, the location is a positive but for others it's a negative. It worked perfectly for us. However the hotel's airport shuttle was very ineffective, both arriving and departing. Other reviewers have noted that they waited a long time after arriving for the shuttle to pick them up, and that happened to us, too. The shuttles from the hotel back to the airport are not regularly scheduled either, and we wound up waiting a long time to get out of the hotel and head back for our flight. Scheduling them at regular times would make a lot of sense. Also, you can take the Water Taxi shuttle from the airport instead, it has a stop right next to the hotel. And as a last resort, you can walk. It might seem a little out of the way at first, but it's only about a ten minute walk. (I walked from the Hyatt to the Budget Rental Car lot...instead of taking the hotel shuttle back to the airport and then jumping on the Budget shuttle back to their property. The Hyatt's front desk staff was friendly and efficient. We paid $194 per room, that's the AAA rate and includes breakfast, a pretty good deal. There was a promotional rate advertised in our room of getting a price break if you get a second room, but it wound up being about the same as the AAA rate and didn't include breakfast. We loved the harbor side view, it was beautiful at sunrise, at sunset and at night. We could have saved money on the airport side view, and if you like watching planes takeoff and land, that would have been pretty enjoyable, too. The view from the elevator is stunning as you come up from the lobby level, you are suddenly presented with a view looking right down one of the shorter runways! We took the water taxi across into Boston each night we were there, which was fun. You can buy tickets at the front desk and charge them to your room, or you can buy them onboard. Same price. Sure, it was a little pricey but what the heck, it's an easy way to get around when you don't have much time and/or don't know the area very well. At night, the hotel's "Lighthouse Light" comes on and sweeps across the dark sky, very cool! The bathrooms were well appointed and quite large but there are no towel racks anywhere at all. So when you're done with a shower and after you've dried off, there's really no place to hang up a towel. Kind of weird. Now, for the skunks. After arriving in the evening and checking in, we were seated outdoors on the patio. It has a lovely view across the water of downtown Boston. The patio is edged by grass on one side and some landscaping bushes and flowers on the other. Unfortunately, that landscaping area is inhabited by a family of SKUNKS! After about thirty minutes at our table, I noticed some of the bushes moving around and figured there was an animal of some kind in there. That's when I got a glancing peek at Skunk #1. At first, my family thought it was a cat but I said "No, that's a skunk. Watch out!" It wriggled back into the bushes. A short time later, skunks #2 and #3 came out of the bushes and started moving towards our table. Other people had noticed this, too but we were the closest table to the skunks and I was afraid we were about to get sprayed! Other diners seemed entertained by this, but none of the waiters appeared to be bothered. The ditzy hostess just giggled and didn't seem capable of giving us a straight answer about the situation.. The skunks eventually moved away and we eventually got our meal. Postscript: the next morning, I spoke with a couple of staff members of the front desk. They said the hotel certainly knew about the skunks, but that the animals had been "de-skunked" and were harmless. It certainly would have been nice to know that during our meal when we ate nervously. Speaking of the meal, one quick aside. Getting our food took almost two hours! The restaurant staff seemed completely overwhelmed by a big wedding reception that was happening right next door to the hotel on the same property. When we complained to the manager about the long delay, he took half off the total bill. That was a nice gesture and saved us about $75. Afterwards, I wondered whether the hotel should put up any kind of sign about the skunks or let people know when they checked in what the situation was outside on the patio. I'm undecided about that but I certainly did not appreciate my unexpected meeting at close proximity to a family of skunks during dinner. I'll be extremely curious if this review gets any response from Hyatt management. In spite of the skunks and the delays getting to and from the airport, I'd stay here again. It's a nice hotel with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view, great hotel, unless you need the airport, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Mainetrippin
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel on business, then again for pleasure. It's just a great hotel. Accommodating service, huge rooms with breathtaking views of the Boston skyline and harbor. Lovely restaurant, including outdoor seating on the water. If you're planning to spend some time in the city, however, the location is a little inconvenient. To get into Boston, you need to take either the T or the water taxi. We took the water taxi over and the T back. I recommend taking the water taxi both ways. The T loses its charm when it's very hot or very crowded. (And maybe in the winter, the water taxi isn't a great idea). But if you need a place to stay the night before a long flight -- this will have you well rested and well fed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not great airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: pgreenld
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this Hyatt is a fairly nice hotel (rooms are fine, fitness center is very nice, service is efficient at check-in and check-out, staff were helpful and friendly). Our only problem was the airport shuttle service by the hotel. We waited longer than 20 minutes for the shuttle. There is no schedule for the shuttle, so you have to show up and wait. If possible, I would suggest they schedule it every 30 minutes, then you'd probably know when to use it since it takes about 15 minutes round-trip with no stops! And, yes, the view is lovely but the hotel itself is located in a slightly remote part of the airport grounds with absolutely nothing, not even the airport terminals, nearby. So, it is really only useful for the airport, and with a not-so-great shuttle, the value is a bit less. Oh yes, parking is over $25 a day!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great views of Harbor but Paper thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: JLLMB79
Reviews.Content: I recenlty stayed at this hotel for one night. This was my first stay at Hyatt Harborside. Postives: Smoothe Checkin, nicely decorated room, nice views of the Harbor from the lobby Negatives: handicap room with bathroom counter I couldn't use because it was so small, paper thin walls (my sleep was interupted by 5am listening to the people next door talking about their golf game) Finally I got up and checked out because I couldn't even sleep with these paper thin walls. I presented the problem to the front desk on check out and he didn't really care. After check out I compared my stay with two other couples in my group and they too had their sleep disterbed by noise on different floors also. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to get a good night sleep. It is really too bad that the walls are so thin because otherwise it was very nicely deocorated.

Reviews.Title: “Not Convenient if the Shuttle doesn't pick you up”
Reviews.Author: Ppeyton600
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels sell themselves as convenient. Called for free Shuttle. Hotel is 3 minutes away. After 15 minutes called again. After 30 minutes shuttle finally arrived. It would have been better to stay downtown, could have gotten there quicker. Told the front desk. No apology at all. Will stay at the Hilton next time... You can walk to the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Ellie_C
Reviews.Content: This hotel has stunnng views and was very nicely appointed. The staff couldn't be more helpful and I found the airport/subway shuttle service very efficient and easy to use. Only complaint was with the food at the restaurant, which given the high prices should have been excellent. I had to send back my dish two days in a row, but luckily I had the same waiter on both occasions and I think he was so embarrassed on the second day the meal was completely free, which certainly helped. If you buy your ticket for the water taxi at the front desk it will only cost you $8.50 single instead of $10. I will definitely stay here again when I'm next in town.

Reviews.Title: “Location could be better, but it wasn't really that big of an issue”
Reviews.Author: Bestbeancounter
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for the week in Boston because she was here for work. After reading some of the reviews I was pretty convinced that the location is the main issue of the hotel. However, after looking at the options to get into Boston, we didn't really find the location to be that big of an issue at all, and our overall stay at the hotel was quite good. We didn't get the city view side of the hotel in our room, but the only time we really looked outside was in the morning to see if we needed an umbrella or not. Commuting wise it cost about 20 dollars to get into Boston, and about 15 dollars to come back. Another option we had was the water taxi which was 17 dollars for a round trip or 10 dollars for a one way. However, the best option we found was taking the Airport shuttle to the Subway, and buying a weekly pass for $15 dollars. I found that going into Downtown Boston took a mere 20 minutes including the wait for the Airport Shuttle. Considering I only had to tip the shuttle driver, I spent very little to get to Downtown for the week. Once I got into Downtown Boston, everywhere was walkable, and the transit maps were very easy to navigate. I ended up spending the whole week commuting around Boston this way, and I didn't feel like I lost any precious time seeing the city because of it, while saving money in the process. As for the rooms, we got a King size bed with all the amenities. The towels were replaced daily, the beds were made daily, everything I expected a hotel to do for a customer it did. The bellmen gave prompt service and the front end counter staff was more than helpful in all my requests. I asked them what I could do to print some emails off my Blackberry, and they just told me to email them and they will gladly print it for me free of charge, rather than having to pay for the business center to do it. Although in regards to value I don't know how that fares. The rooms were about $200 a night at the Hyatt, but factoring in the location of the hotel, I would be interested to know how much it would cost to stay in for example Downtown Boston to know if the value was any good. But from speaking to the event planners who hosted the event at the Hyatt, they mentioned they saved much more money having it at the Harborside than at a hotel in Downtown Boston, and attendees were given additional discounts to the water taxi which was an added bonus. Either way, our stay at the Hyatt Harborside was very enjoyable and other than not being able to step out the front door to see Downtown Boston, there were absolutely no issues with this hotel whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Amazing view of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: snowmanjaz
Reviews.Content: Staff was very courteous. The room we stayed in has an amazing view of Boston. Room was very chic and modern. You can watch the sun set while sipping on a glass wine in the restaurant. Overall we had a great experience. Hyatt has yet to disappoint us. Hyatt we love you!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: amlash
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you do not need to be in the center of town. Good shuttle to and from the terminals. Newly updated rooms. Great work desk. Small but well appointed bathroom. My room had a drop-dead view of the harbor and skyline. The restaurant was excellent if a bit pricey. Very responsive and accommodating staff. I plan to stay on my next trip and use the ferry to cross the harbor!

Reviews.Title: “convenient business centre for the in-a-hurry manager”
Reviews.Author: Arthur291
Reviews.Content: Clearly set up to serve the airport this hotel offers good facilities for the busy businessman. Aside from the excellent views [on one side of the hotel] of Boston, it offers nothing for the tourist. From the moment one arrives there is a scramble to wrest bags from your hands by those eager to supplement their income with tips. Despite the glitzy appearance we found the service poor. For example, every day of the 4 spent here we had to ring down because of a failure to replace used items such as coffee, face towells or even paper cups. Parking is $32 per night and alternative ways of getting into Boston is expensive, a chore or both. Driving into Boston from the hotel is to be avoided as parking is scarce and expensive. Be warned there are no facilities outside those offered by the hotel so add 45mins plus if you plan any form of dining outside the hotel. This is one hotel for those tourists wishing to see Boston would be advised to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Locations and food prices diminish what could be a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiamar
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice and the service I experienced was excellent. Harbourfront view rooms have amazing views of the city, as does the dining room and outdoor terrace. Decent fitness facililty for a hotel with lots of windows and nice views as well. The problems start with breakfast - $17 for 2 eggs and bacon? Seriously? $13 for a bowl of fruit? The hotel can get away with it because there are no other options around and they do the same with parking ($20 as a guest even though thye have plenty of space). You need a car, take lots of cabs or take public transit to get around from the hotel so gouging you for parking in a remote location is just insulting.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dimed to death”
Reviews.Author: BigWill325
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I've ever been in. The hotel is deceptive, we got a great deal (or so we thought) on a room, but ended up being nickel and dimed to death. It is a beautiful hotel (view and rooms), but nothing - and I mean nothing - is free. Want a refrigerator? $25 extra. Want a coffee? $3.50. Want a cart to bring down your bags? Nope, bell hop has to do it ($$tip). Want internet? $10 a day (MacDonalds is free but not the Hyatt). Parking? $30 a day as a guest. Want breakfast? Be prepared to pay; no free continental here. Poor excuse for a buffet $25, eggs and sausage alone $17. I could deal with it if there was another choice, but there is NOTHING nearby. Big thing is that this is not the hotel to stay at if you want to see Boston. Water taxi or ferry is $10 per person one way, (you can also take the subway from/to the nearby stop and the hotel will pick you up at the station for free (about a 15 minute wait), but it isn't as convenient as you might want if you're there to see Boston [plus the subway line going to the airport was out the Sat we were there]) so you end up hanging out in Boston all day (we rested at the Marriot) until after dinner and then dragging back to the hotel late. My family ended up eating up all we saved on the room on transportation and food at the hotel; we could have just stayed at a pricier hotel close to downtown and had a place to go back to rest and recuperate before dinner. Staff was okay, but inconsistent. One person would be the most helpful and nice person in the world, the next the rudest and moodiest - you just didn't know what you were going to get. Room was nice enough, but again it was deceptive. Beautiful bathroom, but no towel rack or bathmat?? No refrigerator or microwave (unless you pay). Single cup coffee maker (as opposed to 2-3 cup maker). Only choices you get for beds are King or two doubles (not queens). I will say that there was no noise from the airport, but yet I could hear the TV in the room next door?? BOTTOM LINE - STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!! There are a hundred hotels throughout Boston that are more convenient, less isolated, just as pretty, with just as good a view, that won't nickel and dime you to death.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Overall”
Reviews.Author: amj63
Reviews.Content: Most reasonably priced accommodations in Boston during the Marathon weekend. Accommodations were nice and rooms clean. While more money, a room overlooking the harbor was beautiful and worth it. If you want complete silence, be sure to request a room that does not have an adjacent door to the next room. Pool could have used a good cleaning. While pricey compared to where I come from, the breakfast buffet was delicious with good customer service. Overall, I am happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there long ago but i can't forget this unpleasant stay..paper thin walls....”
Reviews.Author: jinshui
Reviews.Content: I saved the receipt meaning to file a complaint when i get back home but never had the time to for various reasons. My stay was Sept 19-20 and Sept 24- 26 2008 Room was toward the end of the hall. long hallway to lug baggaes to room, no help from bellhop. I arrived after a 15hours flight. Was happy that it was not a red eye flight so was hoping to catch sleep. At 11pm, smells of smoke and food waffed into my room. Walls are paper thin. After the uninvited odor, for the next 2 hours, loud TV noise. i put up with it with pillows over my head. finally, past 2am, the TV sounds was overrided by loud noises of two persons making out. i dragged my feet to turn on lights and call reception. they came up and of course, insisted there was "nothing" and said they are "full occupancy" then. no way to change room. 15mins later, after a lot my insist, the manager came to the phone. and after repeating the story and expressing my disgust, manager finalyl agreed to come to my room. it didnt take long for her to acknowledge my complaint. suddenly, there was free room (!!??!!!). she offered to change my room IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT. this was passed 3am then. couldnt really think straight except i needed to sleep before my meeting the next morning. i left all my belongings in my room and followed the manager (in my sleep wear) to a different room given to me two floors up, the last one at the end of the hallway, furthest from the elevator. this took about 40mins. i finally shut my eyes about 4am. i meant to take a dip in the indoor pool the next day but the water was cold. so is the water from the shower in the gym/pool. this is an airport hotel. very disspointing that Hyatt havent better quality construction especially when in this particular airport- hotel most of their guests are business travellers, jet lagged, needed undisturbed rest. when i rechecked in few days later, i told the front office and requested the same room which was at the corner, hoping it will be quiet. since i needed to catch a late flight, i asked if i could use their shower room in the gym to freshen up before my long flight. font office made a big deal, as if i am asking for a free dinner buffet.... finally, after a long wait standing at the font office desk, someone finally "gave permission" to let me acces the gym/pool aread to the changing room. when it was time to use the shower, not only there was no cold water (as i had previously found out from few days ago). there was NO WATER at all! bellhop also served as concerige? they have info although not always accurate (but they think they knew it all). only saving grace is nice buffet breakfast, which i had to pay extra for... bedding is superior. internet booking is a better deal than through any other websites, including theirs. it's a shame because personally i havent been so displeased with a Hyatt establishment before. And for what i paid, this is ridiculous. its been over 2 years, and i still remember how terrible my experience was.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Amazing, helpful and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: XxPrincessj83xX
Reviews.Content: I am more than pleased with the stay we had at the Hyatt. It was on our wedding night last June ( sorry for the late post work runs my life). We had a problem with the original hotel we were going to stay at, they lost our paperwork and wouldn't let us stay there without it, so I call the Hyatt and explained that we needed a place for the night. Mind you it was Saturday night and I had called 2 other hotels that were totally booked. The Hyatt felt so bad they said absolutely come on down and we will take care of you. We got there and they expressed how sorry they were that the other hotel was unaccommodating to us. She put us in a gorgeous bedoroom on one of the higher floors with a gorgeous view of the harbor. Also waiting in our room was a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. We were supposed to have those at the other hotel, and she felt so bad she comped them for us. I was more than gracious. The room was immaculate and gorgeous, and the hotel was peaceful and quiet . Just what we needed. The front desk was available for us in the morning, and the bellman was also veyr helpful. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to everyone . It is also a great place to stay if you need to get to the airport , right next door . Thank you Hyatt for making our night so special.

Reviews.Title: “Get'em In, Get'em Out”
Reviews.Author: TraveljohnsonJ
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel is you are looking for an attractive room and a nice bed to grab a few hours of sleep on an airport layover. The beds are very comfortable. However, this is NOT the hotel to consider if you need anything more than sleep. This was my third stay at this hotel and unfortunately, my arrival at Logan, was after midnight. I was informed the shuttle bus would arrive in 15-20 minutes which was reasonable. But after three hours of traveling I was hungry and thirsty and eager to get to this hotel. The ride in the shuttle bus was just short of terrifying. It seemed as though the driver was late in leaving for the night and weaved in and out of the maze of roads at Logan to reach this hotel. This hotel lives up to the old New England adage, you cannot get there from here! How the luggage did not fly from its storage area amazed me when the driver appeared to take the corners on just two wheels! It appears "full service" airlines and hotels is now defined as getting you from point A to B with no services in between. As frequent travelers know, the food service on a multi-hour flight is now limited to a one ounce package of pretzels, the thought of a late night meal once getting to the hotel was not to be. What I really wanted was a cold beer which was not possible, in spite of the fact there were two bartenders behind the bar at 12:30 AM. When I approached the bar and requested a beer, the bartender simply gestured by waving his hand across his neck signifying the bar was "cut off". Not a word was uttered or a simply apology saying the bar was closed. I had to settle with a bottle of soda from the closet gift shop off the front desk. I guess all that â€œserviceâ€� forced the price of soda to $2.50! I wonder why they could not have offered a cold beer in this little closet? Surely they would have made at least $10 for a beer if a soda costs that much. One would think this hotel might think about having some sort of late night snack available for late arriving guests. I have had more considerate service from a Residence Inn. But Hyatt, a supposedly high-end hotel that caters to business travelers? At least they might have suggested a late night pizza place that offered delivery service. I am sorry but this hotel has totally lost sight of who their guests are and what there needs might be. Especially if you arrive at midnight and leave by 7 am. Sadly, service is not something to expect from this hotel or its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of Boston.”
Reviews.Author: SailnJohn
Reviews.Content: The view from our room and from the restaurant of Boston was spectacular! Room was neat and clean, staff was professional and courteous. The shuttle to the airport is very convenient, all one needs to do is call while you're picking up your baggage and it will be at your terminal within 15 minutes. Same outbound, we called as we left the room and it was waiting when we checked out. Shortfalls: For what this hotel costs we thought there should have been complimentary coffee for guests in the lounge, and free internet in the business center. Food in the restaurant is expensive and quality was not commensurate with it's cost. My steak was dry and tasteless, potatoes were cold. Wait staff was attentive to the point of annoyance, if you like being hovered over you may not mind the service. Overall, the view was spectacular, room was good, we were satisfied but expected just a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not for full price.”
Reviews.Author: ExLabRat
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed with this hotel. We got a good deal through Hotwire but if I had payed full price I would have been pretty upset. There were charges for everything but the one that really set me off was a $10 charge for using the Internet! I did not think the room was as clean as I would expect, there was dirty moldy caulking around the sink and a hair on the floor. Also, even though the airport noise was completely blocked, we could here everything that our neighbors were doing... all night... On the up side, the shuttle driver was nice and very helpful, the hotel was in a really convenient location and the rooms were tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Broken faucets ketchup on walls no soap and 7:30 a.m. house keepers”
Reviews.Author: capecodmini
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times and enjoyed this hotel but this time was very, very different. Arrived in room to find no soap in bath room. House keepers were 5 rooms down so went and asked for soap please. Did not understand what I was asking for as they could not communicate in English. No problem, just took two soaps off their cart using smiles and hand gestures and said thank you. Go to wash up and turn cold water knob and it spins and spins and spins and no water comes out. Had to bear down and it finally took but then couldn't turn water off. Knob now pulls straight off so we clamp on it with a towel and manage to stop the flow. Room service was excellent and we had a nice evening. Thought we might try wireless internet but they wanted an arm and leg to connect. The average hotels like Best Western don't even charge for this service any more but we have found that the 4* up hotels always do. You would hope that as long as they were stroking us for $35.00 for 18 hours of parking they would give you internet access but no such luck. Next morning as we are supposedly enjoying a very, very rare sleep-in the darn house keeper is banging on the door at 7:30 a.m. loudly asking for our room service trays. Politely asked them to please go away and we'll put it out later. After showering that morning I notice what looks like blood splattered on inside of bathroom door. Hope it's not. Then notice large amounts of crusty old ketchup splattered on entry way ceiling and walls with congealed drips down wall onto base board and carpet. Not good. Bad walls on this room too. Noise evident from adjoining rooms. This is not what we expect from this hotel. I can no longer recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So Much Noise- I Hardly Slept A Wink!”
Reviews.Author: picklehead123
Reviews.Content: There is something wrong with the soundproofing or insulation at this hotel! I could hear every word of the (very private) conversation my neighbors were having in their room and those of every patron who walked down the hallway. It wasn't just me who was bothered by the noise though- at one point during the night another guest yelled out of his door, "shut the f$%& up!" I hardly slept a wink and had to wake up very early for a flight. If you plan on sleeping well, don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best airport hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: BigMan99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before flying out to the UK. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Our room overlooked the harbour and the views of the city skyline at night were incredible. Room was very spacious and comfortable. Its easy to get into the city, either via a water taxi which leaves directly outside the hotel, or via the subway (courtesy bus drops you and collects you from the station). Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Lmcintyre
Reviews.Content: My 2 young daughters and I were planning on leaving from Logan on a Friday morning so we decided to stay at an airport hotel the night before. I chose the Hyatt based both on the hotel rating and reviews. We arrived there at about 8:30 at night. We were immediately helped with our bags and shown where the front desk was. The check-in was immediate and problem free. Joe escorted us to our room with our luggage, he told us about the hotel during our walk. He brought the bags in the room and gave us a quick layout explanation. My girls were comfortable immediately. They loved the couch and small coffee tables/foot rest. The king sized bed looked neat and comfortable. The desk and TV area were modern and clean. They wanted room service so we found the menu and ordered. The food was served to us within 20 minutes and was delicious. We woke the next day and had time for breakfast so we went to the restaurant on the 1st floor. We had good service and good food. The prices were fine as well, not cheap but not ridiculous either. We went back to the room and finished packing, checked out through the TV option and went down to wait for the shuttle. We were again helped with our bags while waiting for about 10 minutes for the shuttle. The shuttle was clean and the driver very personable. All in all we had a great stay at the Logan Hyatt. I will tell everyone who needs to stay overnight near the airport to try this out. The online rate was even the lowest of all the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Empire in decline? Gorgeous facility ... but needs attention”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of years ago with my family, and came back this winter through a Priceline bid. Positives: Stunning view of the harbor and downtown (though you pay an upgrade fee for rooms on that side), typical Hyatt top-shelf lobby and restaurant, attractive and decent-sized room with fashionable decor and seriously high-quality bathroom flooring, counter, etc. Very clean. Negatives: Location is tough to reach: The water taxi or T ferry is a ton of fun in the summer, but not so much in mid-December. The hotel shuttle to the Silver Line or Blue Line can take a startling amount of time when the weather is bad. The Hyatt franchisee's decision earlier this year to fire the housekeeping staff and replace them with minimum-wage workers was depressing, and I very much regretted supporting it by staying there (But once Priceline takes the bid, you're locked in). You can see the little things are getting away from management here - such as an old room service tray and a roll-out bed left in the hallway for a half-day. The Typical to Hyatt, the nickel-and-diming is out of control. $4 candy bars in the 'gift shop,' $5 bottles of water in the room. Charges for Internet, $32 a night for parking (try the Logan lot instead, it's cheaper ... or skip the car altogether, as we did. Once you get into the city, the T system is terrific. Driving in Boston is a nightmare, and parking is worse.) The restaurant is, of course, astronomically overpriced. Beautiful location with low light, table candles and/or attractive small lights that allow you to enjoy the harbor view at night. A nighttime burger or drink would be great - just didn't get time. Breakfast was good, but way overpriced. The evening visit would be more sensible. The fitness center has a decent number of quality machines, and the pool area COULD be a gem. It's indoor with a hot tub nearby, all surrounded by curving floor-to-ceiling windows looking out on the harbor and downtown. Ought to be magnificent, right? Sadly, some bean-counter put in a cheap acoustic-tile drop ceiling (the sort of thing you'd find in the Motel 6 lobby) with blazing lights. No track lighting, no effort to filter or deflect the light. So, the glare hits the glass windows and obscures the view entirely. The pool, meanwhile, had clean water - but the light-blue paint was getting tan and dirty, and desperately needs a power-wash. The hot-tub jets were working at maybe 50 percent power, and a couple were out of service altogether. The sauna was strong, but that's the only part of the health club that's really up to par. A minimal investment by Hyatt could make this part of the hotel a showcase, but the managers seem oblivious.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dime charges that cost an Arm and a Leg!”
Reviews.Author: KGJM
Reviews.Content: $32 a day for parking $25 for breakfast buffet $20 more for the Boston-side of the hotel $9 for a single shot of Baileys $3 for a lobby cup of coffee 50Â¢ a minute for the internet Stayed here because a family wedding was held here, convenient to the airport ~ but inconvenient to everything else without transportation. The "Harborside Grill" restaurant charges insanely high prices, as does their bar - why? because they are the only game in town. You can't walk, or even short drive to anywhere else... The wedding banquet folks had their stuff together, and everything to do with the event was first class! But knowing the family involved, I am going to make the simple assumption that those that planned the wedding PAID WELL for top notch service and amenities. The large glass windows, and seating take full advantage of the spectacular Boston view. Funny to me that they charge $20 extra to see it from your room! Be the high class hotel in Boston, Hyatt, and stop fleecing folks that are already paying a high room fee with your ridiculous extra charges!

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel but location is a mess”
Reviews.Author: skhemka
Reviews.Content: the hotel is ok but the location is not good. it is near the airport hotels and so you have to go all around the road to get to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Right Beside the Airport...no way to get lost!!”
Reviews.Author: rebels22
Reviews.Content: As soon as we pulled out of the rental car place, we could easily see and reach this hotel. The room was adequate...bathroom a little dirty. and toilet got stopped up...but absolutely beautiful view of Boston! The staff was exceptional!!! They helped me with everything and joined in our conversations about our love for football. They were awesome! The breakfast buffet was really great, but soooo expensive...$25! We had an $18 eggs benedict one morning also. The internet is too expensive to use. The indoor pool and fitness rooms have great views of Boston. There is also a neat sauna. The water taxi is really neat. For ten dollars per person, you can go to one of ten or fifteen spots, such as the aquarium. The water taxi leaves right from the hotel. All and all, this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - Stay Elsewhere! and... Who Pays $9.95/Night for Internet nowadays!?”
Reviews.Author: Briley11
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for an early flight in the morning. The room was efficiently cookie-cutter but... there was hair in the tub, there were no face cloths nor bathmat, the carpet felt "sticky" but worst of all (for a hotel that prides itself as "upmarket") they nickel and dime you for the Internet - even water seemed rather overpriced at $5 for a small bottle- what are they thinking treating guests like that? Not me - I'm not staying there again. This is my worst Hyatt experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and a terrible night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: MisterFlight
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night before flying out the next day. We paid for a superior room for our last night which included a harborside view and because we wanted a good night's sleep after a week of noisy hotels. Our check-in was insignificant - the receptionist was not particularly welcoming. Our luggage was swiftly yaken in hand by Ryan the bell-boy who was very informative and keen to help. He explained that there was a wedding reception on at the hotel that night and pointed out the internet facilities near the lobby, which you had to pay for - the first rip-off considering a lot of cheaper hotels provide this free these days. Our room was very comfortable with a great view of Boston. We ate in the Grill which turned out to be very expensive although the food was good and service reasonably quick. We went to bed early as we were both tired. There was a drinks machine and ice-making machine outside our door and the fan from the ice maker was loud so we complained to the front desk about it and asked to be moved. They explained that all the rooms had been taken (due to the wedding reception) and assured me that the fan switshes off at about 11pm which it did. We were woken up at about midnight by guests returning to their rooms (noisily) from the wedding reception and these included the guests in the next room, which was divided from us by an adjoining door. They had invited guests back to their room for drinks and were talking and laughing loudly and we could hear their conversation through the connecting door. Eventually we had to complain again and someone was dispatched to ask them to keep the noise down (which they did to a certain extent). However, other guests returning to their rooms occurred over the next few hours and kept us awake. The drinks machine / ice maker kept us awake all night with people getting drinks and ice all through the night - can people not do without a drink of coke at 4am??? Either the lift or drinks machine kept making a pinging sound all night when being used - can engineers not design these things to be quiet??? Can guests entering/leaving their rooms not do so without talking at the tops of their voices - jerks??? We could even hear kids running along the corridoor above us at about 2am. When we checked out next morning the guy on the reception was pretty aloof and didn't even ask us how our stay had been. Hotels these days seem to be too involved in the entertainmemt business and have lost track of what they were designed for - to provide us with a quiet night's sleep. These drinks machines outside guests rooms should be de-activated between 11pm and 7am. Effectively we paid through the nose for a superior room and got an inferior room. Won't be staying at a Hyatt Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover”
Reviews.Author: huish
Reviews.Content: I used this as a final stopover before flying on to Maine. It was at the end of a long flight & transfer through Newark so the quick collection in the courtesy shuttle from Logan, helpful driver and brisk check in were all pluses. Beer & a decent club sandwich from the bar menu to round off the day didn't hurt. I discovered that my room abutted the ice making/drinks machine on the landing which wasn't going to allow for an early night but was moved to room with a fabulous view without fuss. Check out and back to Logan was equally efficient. All in all, it did exactly what it said on the tin - restful, efficient, good location. Maybe a 4+ rather than a full 5 but I'd happily go back and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: mabbsy
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here for a couple of days in Boston as we had a very early flight home at the end of it. In many ways the location is fine - the shuttle bus will take you to the airport or the local subway station, and there is a water taxi across the harbour to get into downtown Boston. But there are no restaurants (or shops) nearby so you`re stuck for places to eat if you don`t want to go out far. The restaurant in the hotel is good but pricey. We wanted a bottle of house wine for in the room the first night and the cheapest was 36 dollars plus tax (ouch) Having said that, the room was good and the view over the Boston skyline from our window was jaw-dropping. I enjoyed the indoor pool but my husband was disappointed with the spa which had only a couple of jets working.

Reviews.Title: “excellent 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: remagen
Reviews.Content: When you go to a new city you are always wondering what the hotel will be like, well on our vacation this hotel lived up to the recomendations we were given. Our room had a view of both the airport (our choice) and the river, the room was very clean and on a arrival a nice personal touch of strawberries and brownies being delivered to the room. It was Boston restaurant week whilst we were there and the restaurant gave us a meal to remember, as we ate we watched the sunset over the city listening to some live guitar music. The shuttles were excellent to both the airport and the blue line station, drivers you could talk to and then use their local knowledge. Thank you Hyatt Harborside

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: wetravellots1
Reviews.Content: I think this is a nice location, although there really isn't anything around it. However, it is very easy to get to from the airport. The hotel van was pretty speedy. We went in to Boston for two nights for sightseeing and got this hotel on priceline. It was good for us, we took the water taxi in the morning... it leaves right behind the hotel which is great, you are in downtown in less than 10 minutes. Front desk was courteous enough, but they don't make any effort to accommodate priceline people. Like others have reported, they want to charge you $20 to get a harbor view. We weren't going to be in the hotel long enough to take advantage of it, but it would have been nice. Bar is a little on the pricey side, not a shock. But the 30oz for $10 isn't horrible. The hotel was clean and up to Hyatt standards. One tip is that if you are doing sightseeing, the "Go Boston" card is nice. Its $55 for one day but can pay for itself with 2-3 sights. If you have a go boston card (or voucher) you can get the water taxi for $5 each way instead of $10. All in all a good hotel, great value. We went with another couple and we all had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ATAM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyatt after a long day of moving our daughter into an area college and before the next day's early morning flight. What a treat! Rooms are well appointed; everything feels and looks new. Great beds. Room service was prompt and food quality was high. When we requested foam pillows, housekeeping showed up rIght away and also changed our comforter because it had feathers. This is a hotel that delivers. It gives its customers a stay that exceeds expectations. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with annoying extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Hayduke
Reviews.Content: This hotel overlooks the runway at Logan Airport on one side and the harbor on the other. Our fifth floor room looked out upon the harbor at downtown Boston. Beautiful sight. The room was large, very clean, with an exceptionally comfortable bed and excellent linen. Huge flat screen TV. Oddly no minibar so no place to store a beer for cooling. And as usual there is the rip-off $9.95 a day charge for Internet service you get gouged at all Hyatts. Finally, even though there is enough acreage to park thousands of cars you get gouged another $32 a day to park your car. Hotel restaurant is excellent, with good food and service, though a bit expensive. Got 30 oz of Harpoon IPA for only $10 so that eased the pain some. The was prompt Shuttle service to the MBTA so only $2.00 gets downtown in a hurry. A top-flight hotel. Too bad they feel a need to ding you for the extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 1 night due to cancelled flight”
Reviews.Author: TraciNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to head to Jamaica with friends for our anniversary. We checked in at the airport, bags and all, and just as our flight was to board, they cancelled our flight. No others available until 5:45 the next morning. So, A A said they would put us up in a hotel. When we arrived, I admit, I was cranky, but what can you do, but deal with it. I was impressed, the hotel is clean and elegent. Check in was a breeze, and the front desk staff were very friendly. We were given a harbor view room, which also overlooked a runway (I got to watch OTHER people take off for their vacations!), but the view was very nice, as was the room, clean, neat and large enough. The beds were very comfortable as were the pillows, and we heard no noise. The bathroom was very nice, and the shower was great, plenty of hot water. The amenities were great too, even toothpaste, so we didn't have to unpack everything. We just opened our carry ons. There is complimentary coffee, but the bottle of water that is left for you to use, will cost you $5.00! Speaking of crazy expensive, don't even consider using the restaurant. We were given 20.00 per couple vouchers from the airline, nice touch huh? Except we were charged a $30.00 sitting fee for lunch! A sitting fee? We paid for lunch, tax and tip, plus the "sitting fee". Total cost for 6 people...over $200.00 for LUNCH. We got club sandwiches, burgers and soda, no deserts. Anyway, the gym was nice, and clean, as was the pool and hot tub. There is a ferry that will take you to Faneuil Hall Market place, but we had left our coats in the car at the airport so we didn't take the ferry. We went back to the lounge in the evening for a drink and appetizer, the staff was great, we even met sisters that work there that had been to Jamaica and they gave us some travel tips. The shuttle arrived on time, all six of us could not get on the same flight to Miami, so we left first and there was only 1 other couple on the shuttle. It brought us right to our gate, nice touch.
