If I ever have another flight cancelled, I would stay here again, I would just eat elsewhere. I can't imagine staying here for an extended period of time, as I believe this hotel is over priced.

Reviews.Title: “good for a night”
Reviews.Author: cats77
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my boyfriend when he came here to visit for my birthday. we only stayed a night here so we weren't able to check out everything, but the room seemed pretty good and clean. i wish there was a small coffee table to eat our room service on. they dropped off the food on the desk/extended dresser. overall a decent stay. the bed was really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3-night stay. $10 for 30 oz. of Sam Adams! Only downside: Fuzzy TV”
Reviews.Author: NEVacationer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Harborside for 3 nights total, as I was in town for a weekend conference in downtown Boston. I chose this place specifically because I had a 6:30 AM flight out of Logan Airport on Monday morning, and wanted to make it as simple as possible. Overall, this place is great. I'll probably be back again if I have a tight schedule/early flight out of Logan. Pros: Rooms are clean, well kept. All of the staff, from the concierge to front desk to the shuttle driver were all extremely friendly, helpful, and attentive :-) Contrary to what some others said, I loved the Restaurant/Bar. The pricing at this place is wacky...there are some items such as the Angus Burger w/ fries ($15) that are reasonable. Other menu items, like the buffet breakfast (now $30, up from $25!) are incredibly overpriced. But there's an easy solution to that--just get the items that are a better deal! Oh, I almost forgot the best deal: 30 oz. draft (one glass and a little carafe on the side) of Sam Adams Seasonal for only $10!! Now that is a bargain :-) Cons: There is a stunning brand new 42" flat-screen HDTV in all of the rooms at this Hyatt - even the "regular" rooms - but I was surprised when I turned it on and noticed that it was hooked up to just regular "old-school" cable TV and not an HD feed. To some, this may not matter...but if you plan on catching a show or the evening news, the picture is *very* fuzzy. When you have such a large screen, a fuzzy picture really stands out. If this hotel could improve one thing, it would be getting crisp, HD cable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View - Just Don't Eat There”
Reviews.Author: LindaAtTheCape
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice room - nice exercise equipment - small pool - gorgeous view - only one restaurant and it is ridiculously expensive, especially breakfast. The buffet is $25!!!!!!!!!!!!! Imagine a family of 4 spending ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS on breakfast alone!? If you order off the menu PANCAKES will cost you $17!!! We got a bagel for $5 (cheapest thing) and even had to go get it and toast it ourselves for that price. Trouble is there is nothing else nearby but you could take the water taxi for $10 and walk to a lot of different types of places and get something cheap for less than eating there. Dinner for 4 with only 2 alcohol drinks and one ordering off childrenâ€™s menu was $137 (we did get dessert). Again, cheaper to take the water taxi which is RIGHT next door and walk somewhere. I have to say though that the view was GORGEOUS (watched the sunset over the city skyline and harbor during dinner). Also, parking was $30 just for one night and internet was $10 each day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bit expensive for food, so ate out, nice pool and walk track!”
Reviews.Author: sophielaura
Reviews.Content: Booked this on Hotwire hoping ot get Hilton but didn't. Still good hotel and great price Â£60 per night. Food on high side, so ate on Boston, no worries there though. Next day stay ensured all our luggage went to Hilton so well done to all.

Reviews.Title: “Boston and very nice too!”
Reviews.Author: saratogasally
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family and our room overlooked the Boston sky line and we had to take a boat across tot he North End. Plush and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, clean, just the way it should be”
Reviews.Author: hallemu
Reviews.Content: everything was fine. room was spotless, comfortable and quiet. staff friendly, informative and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “If you plan on venturing into the city, go with the Hilton instead”
Reviews.Author: NicholasV
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when I missed my flight back to Ft. Lauderdale on a Friday night. I had stayed at the Logan Hilton the previous week and was much more pleased with it. On my way back from Cambridge at about midnight the airport shuttle took close to a half hour to arrive after I called it when it should have taken, â€œ15 minutes or less,â€� per the front desk. The Hiltonâ€™s shuttle was much more prompt. Overall the rooms were clean but the rooms at the Hilton had a newer feel. The Hilton was a better value at around $130 vs. $200+ - I would have gladly paid the higher price for the Hilton but it was sold out.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful view for a brief stay”
Reviews.Author: ncftrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hyatt at end of a trip to make an early flight out in the morning. Took t out to airport from our other hotel in copley. Was picked up in a timely manner and the shuttle driver was extremely friendly. He even apologized for the 15 minute wait saying we were on the end of the rounds. It was no problem at all. Even though got the room on priceline, front desk gave us a harborview room when I asked. My son thought this room beat our copley room because you couldn't even see the ground, just water. It was beautiful! Flat screen t.v., ihome as website describes. The unique thing was a huge bathroom with nice shelving in it where they stay the amenities. It's a nice perk that hyatt includes toothpaste as one of their amenities. In the morning, the shuttle was downstairs for someone else so we didn't have to call. Took about 5 minutes to get to airport. Again, super friendly driver. We were tempted to take the handy ride across harbor and see quincy market, but were too tired from our long trip at that point. We ate at the restaurant which was a bit pricey and had limited options for kids. However, I got back to the room to notice that room service menu had pizzas that were reasonable. I probably would have done that. The restaurant was very nice though as it had floor to ceiling windows overlooking the water. Definitely a good romantic venue. There are no nearby options for food. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again on the end of a trip. It is probably even a decent choice if you wanted to make day trips to other towns near boston. If I was with small kids for a short visit to boston, I'd consider this hotel for its easy access to the acquarium and the U.S.S. Constitution. However, stop at a cvs while in town and pick up snacks since no convenience store in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: This was an unintended stay, ie: travel challenges. It turned my whole rotten day around. Fantastic dinner. Great staff. Seriously, it's one of those properties that it seems the employees were put through Happy Boot Camp. Can't say enough about it.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't feel like a 4-star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: rose791
Reviews.Content: If you book your hotel through hotwire, priceline etc. and get a discount, get ready to be treated as if you're staying for free! My husband and I booked this hotel two weeks in advance through hotwire. When we checked in, we requested a room with a king bed and were told that they didn't have any available. We checked in at 7 pm and there weren't many people around in this 15 story hotel. This was later verified by another staff who also said that they should have many rooms with a king bed at the time we checked in!. We were told that we can only get a room with two queen beds. The staff's attitude was totally annoying, but there was nothing else to do since we had already paid for two nights. The beds were not queen as they claimed but they were double instead! My husband and I ended up sleeping in different beds, which were really old and not comfortable at all. It goes without saying that we didn't have a harbor view from our room, probably also because we booked it through hotwire! Even though, there were not many people staying in the hotel, almost every room in our hallway was occupied and it was very very noisy! We had hardtime falling asleep and when we did, we woke up in the middle of the night with horrible noises coming from the next room through the thin walls. In short, our stay was a complete torture! My husband and I stayed in many hotels all across the country and never experienced something like that in a so-called "4-star hotel"! Nice view and closeness to the airport are the only pros we could see. This hotel doesn't deserve its 4 stars!! Don't waste your money! You can do much better than Hyatt Harborside!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnight stay and catching early a.m. flight”
Reviews.Author: ukadvisor
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is so convenient to get to and from the airport via the free 24hr hotel shuttle (5-10mins). All you do is call them from the free hotel phone next to the Information booth. The reception staff were excellent and friendly and even helped me with printing my boarding passes when the lobby computer/printer wasn't working properly. My room was large, comfortable and faced one of the terminals, runways and part of the harbor. The great thing was that it was so quiet and I slept like a baby after ordering their famous New England Clam Chowder. Yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent View”
Reviews.Author: JimKNYC
Reviews.Content: The view is wonderful. The suites are upscale. The service is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding View!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirlfla
Reviews.Content: Depending on what you're there for, you can't beat the location. We were catching a plane the next day so only had limited use of the hotel amenities. Great location for a quick boat taxi over to downtown Boston. Spent three whirlwind hours walking the Freedom trail and eating in a delicious Italian place in the North End and still got back to the hotel to enjoy a spectacular sunset at the patio bar/restaurant. Patio also had firepits going, so we were outside a lot longer than we planned, but you didn't want to leave the view. Boston skyline at night! Room was updated and comfortable and larger than most. Bathroom very nice, bed was good. Other than that we didn't use the facilities. Watch out for the food prices....outrageous! $25 for a breakfast buffet that was no better than an Embassy suites free hot breakfast... Oh yeh, incredibly quiet also. Didn't hear a single plane or neighboring room.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LianOntario
Reviews.Content: We got a room on a higher floor with a very beautiful harbor view ^^ We both love it and the room was clean. The staffs were nice and helpful. However, the parking fee is very expensive. If you want to take the free shuttle from the station back to the hotel, then you have to make sure you have enough time to wait for that. We waited for more than 30 mins after we called the front desk >< So we took the airport shuttle (one of them will go to the water taxi stop which is just next to the hotel) on the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with easy airport access”
Reviews.Author: Christina_9
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with amazing views of Boston over the harbor. Even the elevators take advantage of the great view! We stayed here the night before our early a.m. flight, and were upgraded when the hotel found out we were starting our honeymoon. The rooms are new and decorated in a modern, fresh way. Great bathroom/shower and TV. We wanted to eat dinner in Boston, so we took the free airport shuttle to the blue line metro station, and went into town to eat at Faneuil Hall. Easy and cheap. First thing in the morning, we took the quick free shuttle to Logan (less than a 10 minute ride). The Hyatt was the perfect start to our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darn good, but rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: No_junkmail
Reviews.Content: The family and I stayed at this hotel to see the New Year's Eve fireworks over Boston Harbor. Unfortunately, the fireworks were cancelled! Obviously that wasn't the hotel's fault. The hotel has an amazing view of downtown Boston--if you book a room with a harbor view. Otherwise you are overlooking the parking lot and the airport. The hotel itself is pretty standard Hyatt (the decor, etc.). The hotel is relatively new, so you don't have to worry about ending up a hotel that had a "renovation" that was no more than new paint and carpets, yet. I mention this because parts of the hotel (mainly around the conference/reception rooms) are pretty beat up. The hotel has an awesome gym (with a great view of Boston) and a nice pool (it's really designed for doing laps). Getting to and from the hotel by car is relatively easy, but they kill you on parking fees. Expect to pay in excess of $30 dollars to park your car--as a guest! They have a shuttle from the airport that is convenient, and that I believe is free (unlike in Europe). Getting to downtown Boston is easy by car, but don't rely on a GPS to get you there. You have to go through a tunnel, so you'll lose your GPS signal and come out of the tunnel with your GPS effectively useless when you need it most. We took the water taxi to downtown Boston from the transportation center right next to the hotel (VERY convenient). The hotel room service food was excellent (and I've stayed at other high-end hotels that had crappy room service food), and the staff that brought the food were all excellent as well. The bell staff on the other hand were not so good. The older, more experienced bell staff were very professional. The younger bell staff were not very professional. The best example I can give is the young bellman yelling a question across the lobby to my wife--not what you expect at a Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal Through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: ZekeKelso
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap place to stay for one night before a 5:30 AM flight. Luckily, it was easy to pick the Hyatt up for $52 ($66 including taxes and fees) off priceline. I can't say much about the Hotel. I was there for less than 8 hours, most of which were spent sleeping. But it perfectly met all my needs: the room was very nice, front desk was good, wake-up call came and the shuttle was very quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views and Close Proximity to Airport”
Reviews.Author: YYZAC
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline for $60 ($75.26 with fees/taxes) two days before my arrival in Boston. With an impending snow storm coming I actually booked this hotel as our connecting flight from Canada arrived at 8:00 a.m. and our onward flight to London was that evening and Boston was expecting a snow storm. Upon arrival at Terminal B, waited on the curb in the "courtesy shuttle" area for a while before I called the hotel and found out that it is necessary to call for the hotel shuttle. Hotel shuttle arrived within 10 minutes and we were off to the hotel. TIP: It is not necessary to take the hotel shuttle, which does weave it's way around the terminals and can take up to 15 minutes to arrive at the hotel as other reviewer's have said. It is possible to take the airport's own inter-terminal shuttle bus marked "Boat Docks/Water Shuttle". Get off at the boat dock stop, it is right beside the hotel and literally 20 steps to the side hotel entry. The shuttle is free and is more frequent that the hotel shuttle. Although I was unsure if the hotel would allow my son and I to check in at 9:00 a.m. when their posted time clearly indicates 3 p.m., I was pleasantly surprised when Louie at the front desk not only allowed us to check in, but even offered us a choice of bed type. Our room was 1507 and had a great view across the harbor to the skyline of Boston, until the snow storm arrived that afternoon. The room did have a hotel information book; however, there were no envelopes or writing paper inside the book. The room itself was clean, modern and did have black out curtains on the window. The public areas were also clean although there is not much of a lobby. There is a sitting area on the second floor overlooking the first floor restaurant with excellent views of the city. As other reviewers have stated there is a water taxi service just outside the hotel to the city. However, it probably cheaper to take the shuttle to the blue line subway and get into the city this way. I met several other hotel guests who went into the city this way for dinner and they seemed quite satisfied with their decision. All three elevators to the guest rooms are glass and offer a great view of the airport and city. Breakfast buffet was $25; however our waitress did not charge me for a coffee and granola when my son ordered the full buffet, which I thought was nice. Although it turned out that we didn't end up staying overnight, we did on our return journey through Boston two weeks later. Again, the room we were given on the tenth floor was facing the city with a great view of the city lights. On our second return stay I booked from an airport Internet terminal, again on Priceline for $65 ($80.96 with taxes/fees), about 30 minutes before we arrived at the front desk. This time I flagged down the hotel shuttle outside the terminal. Upon arrival at the desk the reservation was already in the system and was again offered a choice of bed types. The front desk even provided me with a razor and shaving cream free of charge. On this second stay, my son and I ate dinner in the restaurant. We both had the surf & turf and the bill total came to just under $100 with drinks and gratuitity. We both thought the meal was amazing. I used the Internet in the Business Center, just to the right hand side of the front desk. They charge 0.50 per minute with a $5 minimum. A credit card is needed. It would have been great if the hotel had a free terminal for guests to use, but I did find the speed of the Internet excellent. On both visits we did not use the pool, but we did take a look at it. It seemed adequate with a small pool and hot tub. There is an exercise room adjacent to the pool area and there are changing facilities within the pool area. Overall, we both a had a great experience at this hotel and would highly recommed it to anyone who may have a stop over in Boston or an early morning flight the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, comfy hotel, ultra-convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: CAFamilyRvwr
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the views--either of the bay and the city of Boston, or (just as intriguing to some) over Boston Logan airport, so you can watch planes take off, land, and overall airport operations. The views are great, and provide a great diversion or relief from business meetings during the day or down-time relaxation during the evening. Another great part of the hotel is it's convenient location to the airport. From stepping off the plane to getting into my room, it took 20 minutes with the free hotel shuttle. There is a water taxi service from the hotel to Boston. And even though it's an airport hotel, it's a comfortable experience, no annoying noise from the airport (even in a room that faces the airport), and wonderfully upscale. This hotel was selected and paid for by an organization that held a meeting there, so I can't comment on value. Staff could have been a bit more responsive in accommodating a late checkout request. But overall, it was a great stay, and much better than expectations for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views but shame about the quality”
Reviews.Author: mystic100
Reviews.Content: Having arrived tired from long days travel all started well with the free shuttle bus arriving promptly, and a friendly driver assisting with our luggage. A short drive and we were there. Rooms at the back of the hotel have great views of the Boston Skyline and harbour but considering the amount of time spent in your room is it really worth the extra $80 per night? Rooms on the higher floors at the front whilst not having such good views do offer an interesting view of half the airport with most runways visable - yet there was no disturbance from airport noises. Better value for $80 less - you bet! Rooms are of a good size and are very comfortable. However given we had to change rooms on two ocassions during a two night stay it is diffcult to recommend this hotel - specially at the premium prices charged. On the first morning we woke to find a two foot square of the entrance carpet saturated in water from an unknown source. The maintainance staff couldn't locate the problem. The drying equipment didn't work and they were unable to get a replacement. To be fair the front desk attended very promptly and offered a free upgrade to a room with a harbour view. The next room we were put in had a broken TV and two inch nails sticking out of a three foot section of skirting board so required a further move. With a relatively captive audience the meals in the hotel carry an expected premium. Again to be fair the quality was very good, but both the breakfast and the evening meals we had turned out to be the most expensive (by a considerable margin) we had during our entire 3 weeks in New England! Transportation to downtown has already ben covered in other reviews In summary - Yes the harbour view is excellent and the rooms (when you find one without a problem) are nice but would we stay here again - almost certainly not, particularly given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent and fun!”
Reviews.Author: J2S2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights on both sides of our flight in and out of Boston. The hotel airporter picked us up in a timely manner and the driver went out of his way to let us know that they would take us to the subway later if we wanted to go into town. Worked like a charm, but it did take some time. Later we used the water taxi. It picks you up essentially in front of the hotel and drops you off at several locations, we used the aquarium. It costs $17.50 round trip, but is convenient. Our room had a great view of downtown Boston across the harbor. It was well appointed, clean and quiet. The restaurant was not inexpensive, but the food was good and it also had a great view. If I were going to stay in Boston longer than a couple of days, I'd probably stay downtown. But if you are staying for a couple of days and want the assurance of easy airport access, this place fills the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Average Staff”
Reviews.Author: ashavor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hyatt one night whilst on a business trip. I used their free shuttle from the aiport, it is a nice shuttle but makes so many stops, I was on the thing for over a half hour for a hotel that is 3 miles from the airport. Had I known this, I would have taken a cab. I found it very annoying after a long flight. First of all the hotel itself is lovely. As you walk in, there is a fantastic view, across the water, of Boston. All the public areas are decorated to a high standard, lots of seating with great views, nice bars and restaurants, etc. My room was very large and newly decorated. King sized bed with lots of pillows, large work space with WIFI, sofa with leather ottomans, new carpet. The bathroom was nice, but it was obvious when they remodelled it, they left the old tub & tiles, so they looked dated and out of place. Overall I would give the room high marks. Surprisingly what lets the hotel down is the staff. They do not offer the levels of service and attitude for a hotel of this standard. A few examples: The front desk did not even welcome me, they just asked for my name,asked for a credit card and pointed to where the elevators were. They did not even tell me the room number. No one asked if they could help with my bags (single woman travelling alone with 2 bags, 1 huge) . Once I got to the hotel room (around 6:30 pm) A group of housekeepers was cleaning (?) a room across from mine. Actually there was one person in the room and the others were in the hall chatting but keeping it loud enough that the one in the room could hear and participate. After about 15 min, I popped my head out the door and just looked at them. I thought that would be enough for them to get the message. I was wrong, after about another 15 minutes, I opened the door and gave them the SHHH sign (they didn't speak English) and they just looked at me and continued on with their loud chatting. I thought this was extremely rude. The only reason it stopped, was the room was finished and they moved on to annoy someone else. I would stay here again, but I would not look forward to it as I usually do when I stay in hotels of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: andyman88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HYatt recently near the airport. Its a nice location but BEWARE the onsite parking is 32.00 per day over night. They "convienently' failed to mention this when we made our reservation. YOu can park nearby at the airport parking lot overnight for only 18.00 a day and use the Hyatt free shuttle to get back and forth! The views are amazing and the pool and hottub area is nice and well kept. Room service and restaurant charges are absurd ie: 25.00 for breakfast and 26.00 for a waffle thru room service so better to eat elsewhere if you dont want to get hosed. Rooms are spacious, modern and clean but the shower had moldy looking stuff in the grouts as did a wall vent

Reviews.Title: “Fab location but don't expect to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Lotzsan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our last night as we had a 9am flight back to UK. Wonderful room, location and excellent service but we only managed to get two hours sleep. The problem is that the room doors do not have any pressure closing hinges, and therefore slam very loudly. In fact, no matter where along the corridor you are, you can still feel the vibration and hear the noise from one end to the other. To make it worse, there was a function on at the hotel as it was Friday night, so people were going in and out of rooms down to the ice machine till 2am. Between 11pm and 2am we counted 24 slamming doors - each time you felt you were finally nodding off....SLAM - wide awake again! Then, at 4am - SLAM - people were leaving for early flights - although we love the Americans, they are very noisy and shouted from one end of the corridor to the other as well as letting the doors slam. We gave up at 5am and went to the airport to catch up on some sleep! Wouldn't stay there again which is a shame because the hotel is stunning.

Reviews.Title: “DIFFERENT VIEW OF BOSTON”
Reviews.Author: jennboye
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt 4 nights. Not sure if it's a 4 star, but it's close. Let's go 3-1/2 to be safe. Room was comfortable, clean and fairly large. Bed and pillows were super! Bathroom was OK...clean but in need of an update and re-grouting. Has a business center but WOW..crazy expensive. Great views both sides. Fun glass elevator. Really close to the Airport with free shuttle which is nice if you have an early or late flight. In hind sight I would have spent my last day there for the convenience of the airport but in town the rest of my stay. There is NOTHING around the hotel. The water taxi into town is spendy everyday. $17 (plus tip) round trip so you kind of have to add that on to you nightly stay. And if you have to do it twice it's a bummer. The Harborside Grill at the hotel is good but pretty spendy as well. Although it has a great kids menu and the adult portions are huge. You can share a meal easily. All in all it was a pleasent experience and would absolutly stay there again.... especially on my last night in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, walls like paper and expensive to eat at!”
Reviews.Author: IRISHGIRL767
Reviews.Content: Ok, Our family likes to go to Boston for a weekend before school starts. Last year we stayed in Framingham and drove in. This year I wanted to stay closer. Hotel rates are insane in the city and all they had were rooms with 1 bed (king or Qn). We had 3 people. This was the only hotel I found in the area I wanted, that had 2 beds in a room. We booked it with AAA rate of $215/night not a bad rate. (good thing) But we had to pay $32/night to park in their large parking lot (bad thing). It was pouring raining when we got in Friday night so instead of walking around the city in the rain, we ate at the Harborview Grille. WAAAAYYYY Expensive! almost ridiculous. Even tho the food was good. It wasn't THAT good. There was a wedding both fri and sat night. No big deal, except on Fri night ..er sat morn 4am. This woman, who I assume was drunk, tried opening our room door not once, but twice til she figured out she was in the NEXT room. (woke us all up) The walls are made of paper. You can hear every noise in the hall. I was surprised. But when this woman made it into her room she was on her cell phone. yes at 4 in the morning talking to a guy. I know this because she had him on speakerphone and I could hear their conversation as tho they were at the foot of my bed. After 1/2 hr of this I got up and was ready to go bang on her door, but then it got quite in there. (that sucked) The rooms are big and spacious, we had a harborview room. The view was awesome. The bathroom was large, the shower stall I thought could have been updated for a HYATT. The beds are not as comfortable as the website claims...but they were also DOUBLES. I haven't seen a double bed in about 25yrs. I had to sleep with my 10yr old daughter and we barely had enough room. I did not sleep well there. And there was definately enough room for 2 Queens. It was extremely convienent to have the water taxis right behind the hotel. That's how we got back and forth to Downtown. $17/person roundtrip..kids under 12 ride free. Now...back to the Harborview Grille. On the last day we decided to eat breakfast there instead of grabbing something quick in the city. And even tho it was expensive...It was very good. Buffet breakfast was $25/adults...$12/kids. I had the best omelet I've ever had. And our waitress was great. She actually saved us $4 on my daughters breakfast. We're like applebee's, outback kinda people so I'd say the restaurant was a bit high end for us. There is a pool, sauna and work out room. None of which we used. But we checked it out. The staff in general was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: seattle2005seattle
Reviews.Content: We paid $167 (with taxes) on Priceline for one night at the Hyatt Harborside. We were given a room opposite the harbor on the 14th floor which faced the airport. We actually enjoyed watching the planes take off and land and the windows were completely sound proof. We ate dinner at their restuarant (Harborside Grill). We were given a table at the window that had a gorgeous view of the harbor. The food was a bit expensive but very good. The room itself was pretty standard for a 4-star hotel--a big, comfortable bed with nice linens. Our only complaints would be that there was no safe, no mini-fridge, no free internet, and it took the airport shuttle bus about 35 minutes to show up at the airport to pick us up after we called.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view from the west side”
Reviews.Author: janeenee
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a wedding which was held on sight in a tent on the south lawn (reception). The view from the outdoors and west side is fabulous. I found the front desk and concierge friendly and helpful. Agree with some prior reviews about some things lacking in the room: no safe, no book with a list of amenities, no paper or pens and for our eastside room a room darkening shade is needed (after a night of partying I didn't need the rising sun in my eyes at 6am) Disagree with some other reviews on cleanliness and the comfort of the bed, I thought both were up to par. A good place for an event, perhaps a little pricy just for a layover, I paid $179 and that was a discounted event price with a view of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: casalinda
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel located at Logan Airport. However, you should only stay at this hotel if you are flying out the next day. It is too expensive to take a taxi back and forth into Boston. The hotel is good and the staff is wonderful. I can't fault the service. However, there are some annoying problems. First, there are no safes in the rooms. Even lower rated hotels have in-room safes. Second, the housekeeping is a hit and miss thing. Sometimes there are no wash clothes, other times no face towels. Sometimes there is no shampoo, other times no conditioner or bath soap. It is as if there is no check list of what should be in the bathroom. I know these are small problems but they can be annoying when you arrive late at night and are tired. The view from the harbor rooms are spectacular. It is worth the extra money to have that view. The restaurants are expensive but good. Room service is prompt and really expensive. One problem the hotel does have , is the noise in the hallways. Doors are constantly slamming, dogs bark all the time and kids run up and down the halls. I know the hotel can't control this but it does make sleeping difficult. I would stay here again if I were flying in and out of Boston, but one night is enough. This is not a hotel for a long term stay. Too far from the city of Boston and all its atractions.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty to the Max!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmwlaw
Reviews.Content: Okay, I came in for a quick visit to Boston. Figured staying at the airport (usually stay downtown) was the best thing in light of the short time available. Picked the Hyatt having stayed there before and liked it a few years back. Got in late and all I wanted was a shower. But when I arrived, there was a nasty surprise--mold in the bathroom. I was too tired to change rooms and, instead, washed up in the sink and made it through the night until my mid-morning flight. When I told the front desk about the mold upon checkout, she told me she would send housekeeping up to clean it up. Hopefully, they did clean it..but it was too late for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: phil1669
Reviews.Content: Great views, it is well worth paying the extra for a harbourside view, The terrace is a lovely place to sit and eat dinner as you look out over the bay to down town Boston. Water taxis are frequent and cost $10 one way or $17.50n return. If you are coming back late a normal taxis is about $25 from downtown. Food served was not al acarte but resonable for the price. Strangely there was no information pack in the room regarding the facilities offered in the hotel. Is great for couple of days either at the begining or end of a holiday. For a longer stay, perhaps a downtown hotel would be easier.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and great views”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we had an early flight back to the UK, and wanted to stay a couple of nights in one hotel. Downtown Boston is easily accessible via the water taxi, which is actually a far nicer way to reach it than by cab. Our room (1207) was a Harbor View, and was nicely decorated, with fantastic views of Boston across the water. We turned the sofa round so that we could just sit and watch the view! Everything was clean and comfortable, although we were surprised that there was no mini bar / fridge. The vending machine on our floor didn't work either. The gym on the ground floor is well equipped and popular, with good views over the water. Service was mixed: the concierge desk were very helpful, but service in the bar could be slow. Bar meals were very good, however. Breakfast was also good (although ours was interrupted by a fire alarm, which was well handled). The shuttle bus to the airport was also fine, even at 6 in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “One night at Hyatt harborside”
Reviews.Author: ljn_uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night (friday) at Hyatt harborside as we had a transatlantic flight to catch at 9am. We check in during the early afternoon with the plan to spend the afternoon /early evening in Boston. Our plan worked well, and is worth considering for those with a morning flight out of Logan. No queue to check in on arrival, left luggage with bellman & headed up to the room - luggage was delivered within 10 mins. Our room on 9th floor, had a fantastic Harbor view - so good you could take a photo from the room!!. Room had 2 Queen beds, medium to firm matress, with good quality linens, room was decorated in a modern style. Armchair by window, ipod docking station, bathroom with tub & shower but no bathrobes. Toiletries were basic - I have to admit though am not a fan of the hyatts portico toiletries. Room was clean but not overly large. Glasses & ice bucket provided (ice machine on each floor). NO aiport noise whatsoever from the room, but you can hear noise from the corridor - lucky for us we had quiet neighbours!! The lift is fun - you get a waterview as you travel up & down!! There is a nice patio area outside where you can dine or have a drink with a great view (at night the staff light candles & lanterns & its quite lovely) - but the indoor bar area was a dissapointment, not inviting & not a place to linger. Staff seemed overstreched but remained polite. Food was good but not great, Calamari appitizer was very large (enough for 2) and tasty. The water taxi is available just outside the hotel - be sure to use the "walkie talkie" to call for a taxi as they appear to wait offshore rather than at the dock. We used the service to get to Boston & it was a fun experience. Taxi service runs till 10pm, so you do not have to dine at the hotel restaurant. Although hotel was busy the pool/gym was empty, we used both. Lockers/towels provided & water, cool towels & apples were available. Pool is saltwater & affords you a view of the harbor whilst you swim The jacuzzi was very hot. There is also a sauna which we did not use - With the heatwave Boston was expereincing we were hot enough!!. Early morning bellstaff came for luggage & we had a short wait for one of the two (free) shuttles to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisncraz
Reviews.Content: I'm from the Boston area and know that this hotel has a great reputation. I needed to be at the airport at 5:30 am, so I decided to priceline my way to a room at the Hyatt Harborside. I used a well known website that helps people figure out what hotels priceline offer, in what area, and for how much. Anyway... I checked in very quickly and efficently. The view of intown from across the harbor is just amazing from the lobby! The lobby echos as well, just an odd side note. I asked for a rather odd request, I wanted the a great view of the airport to watch the planes come in. Usually they get harbor view requests, but being a Boston native, I'd seen and sailed it enough. We got a room on the 10th floor that overlooked the cargo terminal, some runways, and Terminal B. It was great! The elevator was pretty with again great views of the city as you escalated up! Liked previously said, I could not hear an airplane but the real "traffic" was outside in the hallway! You could hear everything from outside that door! Not a big deal but those tripadvisors were correct! The first thing I did was to go swimming in the pool! The view was amazing from the pool as well. They had towels, cold water, cold towels, and apples in the gym beside the pool. They had plenty of quality towels poolside. The pool was indoors and could be noisy with kids! BUT! The pool water was saline (a bit of salt and fresh water)! It was great on my skin! It felt so good, that I didn't take a shower after! I felt nice and clean getting out of the pool! The pool was the right temperature and clean! I took the local water taxi into for 10 bucks and had a great meal at Boston favorite Legal Seafood. Ironically, I had filet mignon at a great seafood place! Anyway, I took the water taxi back and spent the night watching planes come in. It was wonderful! The room itself was very clean, modern, and comfortable. The wake up call for my early fight was arranged by the front desk and I was on my way using the shuttle which was very prompt. Overall, an excellent stay at the Hyatt! I would highly recommend using this hotel even if you're just staying intown. I love the view of the city and airport, plus it's just fun to use a water taxi! I paid $115 using priceline for a Friday in early June! Again, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but be prepared to pay for almost everything”
Reviews.Author: sc00p
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from its website and secured a AAA discount rate of $120/night that included the buffet breakfast for two for three nights. Check-in was quick and easy. Every staff member encountered was pleasant and helpful. The pros of the hotel are the view, the staff, and the cleanliness. The cons are the outrageous prices they charge for some services and the fact that a charge exists for other services. For example, parking overnight for guests is $32, and prices at the restaurant are unreal - if I remember correctly $16 for a plate of pancakes??? A glass of house wine $9. Internet access is not free. The cost is $9.95 /day or if using the hotel business center $ .50 a minute. Dialing 800 numbers has a fee as well. The hotel is isolated which doesn't help. The harbor side view rooms (odd numbered) are nice. I stayed on the 14th floor and had a great view. The room was clean, smelled good, and was a pretty nice size. I agree with another reviewer that you can clearly hear doors slamming and people talking in the hall. Housekeeping knocked on the door sometimes during the 8AM hour which seemed a little early. USA Today is delivered at the door and other papers can be purchased from the hotel store. I did not see the WSJ. The breakfast buffet is nice and includes eggs, bacon, potatoes, cereals, fruits, pastries, and juices as well as made to order omelets and Belgium waffles. Overall, I recommend this hotel and the staff strives to make your stay enjoyable. Just remember that a fee is associated with most amenities except for the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: n6877
Reviews.Content: this hotel is literally at the end of a runway at boston logan airport HOWEVER you can not hear any airplane noise!!!! Great views of boston harbor and downtown boston. there should be more places like this out there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingASAP
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this Hyatt. My husband was attending a conference so I tagged along. The rooms are clean, beds comfy and great shower pressure in the bathroom. Our room on the 9th floor faced west with a gorgeous view of Boston harbor. The room was very quiet being so close to the airport also. The only downside is that this hotel is located in an area that is a little isolated. There aren't any restaurants or food places within walking distance, so the only option is the Hyatt resaturant. The prices are high as expected at a hotel restaurant-breakfast was $18 for eggs and toast. The positives-the hotel will take you to the "T" anytime to catch the subway to the city of Boston. It's easy and cheap. Buy a "Charlie Day Pass" and enjoy walking Boston. The staff is wonderful. Any concerns or questions are immediately addressed. Great hotel, would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: kjfiliault
Reviews.Content: Very Beautiful View of the Water and City , very nice comfy bed and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!! If you visiting Boston, stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Surrey_Travel_Monkey
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Boston with my Girlfriend and another couple. We were only staying one night and went online to find a suitable hotel. All the city centre hotels were very expensive but we found this one out by the airport and after checking the map we figured it should be do-able. When booking we found that the Harbour view rooms were on a special rate and decided to go with that. Best descision of the holiday! We drove up to the entrance unpacked the cases from the boot of the car and walked through the front door. WOW!!! on the far side of the lobby is a massive wall of glass looking directly across the harbour to the city. We got a room on the 9th floor and rushed up there to check the view again. Amazing. Boston looks fantastic across the water, even better than Manhatten Island. At night the view became magical. travelling into the city was fun and easy. On our way in we chose to catch the harbour taxi on the jetty outside the hotel. $10 gets you into the city and takes about 5/10 mins. As this service finishes at around 10pm we took the subway back to the airport and from there you call the hotel for the free shuttle. It was so easy if I go back to boston I'm staying there again. Having visited many hotels on business this one was all I would expect from a 4 star hotel. It was clean, well presented and the staff were friendly and helpful. If you staying in boston, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mozart1888
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for a night after arriving late to the airport, but staff was so friendly and helpfull that really marked us. Excellent breakfast, again with nice waiters. Will come back when we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sylvainautourdumonde
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Harbourside is located near the airport and offer a wonderful view of Boston's skyline or of the airport. In either case, it's a fantastic view. There is a free and very efficient shuttle service from/to the airport. The lobby offer a great view of the city's skyline. The check-in was courteous and quick, but not more (not especially friendly). I received the room type I had reserved (Sheraton doesn't always do that). At check in I requested to receive the Wall Street Journal instead of the content free (!) USA Today. I was told no problem. But of course the next day I received the USA Today. When I went back to front desk to ask for a WSJ, they told me that they don't carry it at all in the hotel, except at the gift shop ! Room was spacious, clean and very well decorated. Bed was confortable. The view of the airport was fantastic and strangely enough no noise from airport was heard in the room. The meeting facilities are modern and confortable, but Intenet access that you buy in the room doesn't work in the meeting room ! Very disappointing. Of course, in term of location you have to be aware that there is nothing around since you are on airport ground. The easy solution is to go downtown using water taxi (17$ round trip). So a very nice, modern, confortable and up-to-the-standard hotel, but with a few minor glitches. The Intenet one though is hard to swallow.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had known it was there sooner”
Reviews.Author: Knows
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hidden from view when you drive into the airport. I have stayed at the Hilton, Embassy Suites, Hampton Inn, Courtyard Marriott and Holiday Inn. No more. The Hyatt has the best view of the city! Across the water, a perfect view. If we were there longer, a water taxi could have taken us across the water to the New England aquarium. The room was fine. Fresh and clean. We ordered off the room service menu. The kids didn't like the pizza, which wasn't the greatest, but I had the tuna sandwich and it surprised me. It was wonderful. The price of the hotel was very reasonable, at $189/ night. Shuttle to the airport was prompt. All staff I came in contact with were polite and more than willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel second stay here. It's got everything without being in the centre of town. But is only a water taxi or norma ltaxi away from town. Great views over the harbour. Great food and facilities ofr the kids.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff - isolated location”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: The staff at this particular location was incredibly freindly. From teh guy who drove the shuttle from the airport, to the front desk, even just the staff walking around. My wife and i were walking towards the elevators, and a staff member was coming the other way, turned around, walked back the way she came just to push the button on the elevator for us. Everyone said "hi", just a very friendly staff. Great views of the harbor, but you got the same views from teh lobby or on the elvator ride up, so i am not sure it is worth teh extra money. the guy at the front desk offered the harborside view for the same rate if i took the 2 doubles instead of the king, but I had a 2 year old who much prefered watching the planes at the airport anyway. Very easy to get to from the airport, shuttle was there right away. You dont even need their shuttle if you dont want to wait because the airport shuttles go to the water taxi station/boat dock right next door anyway. The hotel is somewhat isolated for tourists. There is no other food except the hotel and the airport close by, and most of the airport concessions are through security checkpoints. The food a the hotel i found to be very expensive (although i am admittedly a budget traveler), but the breakfast buffet was $25! To get to the city, the water taxi is right outside, but kind of expensive (34$ round trip). The hotel or airport shuttle will take you to the blue line subway, or the silver line picks up at all terminals (terminal A is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel - all sidewalk + safe)

Reviews.Title: “For Budget Travelers, Bring Your Own Bottled Water!”
Reviews.Author: love6kies
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru Hotwire for my 2 nights stay for my business trip to Boston. I choose air port location to save money for the parking fee,but this hotel charges everything and everything is expensive. I paid $40 per night to get a harbor view room, but this is agreeable. The complains about this hotel is; make you feel isolated staying here because there's no store or restaurant in the neighbourhood. I was thirsty, and wanted to buy a bottled water at the veinding machine, I thought it's a bit cheaper than $5 bottled water in the hotel room, however, the machine has only sodas! I had to go to convenience store right nexr to the lobby.The store has a small refridgerator and there were sodas and starbucks mocha drink, but there was no water. I asked front desk person if I can purchase a bottled water. I paid $2.50 for the small bottle & realized I should have just had $5 water in the room that's twice the size than that I have just gotten! Because of the location, I choose to order room service and surprised that they charge $31 for Lobster ravioli. I ended up to spend $70 for dinner. Their service charge is about $8 compared to other 4 star hotels usually charge $3.95 the most.The ravioli was actually impressive that they have a lobster tail in the middle of the plate. However, the taste of this ravioli is desappointing that they use curry for the sauce and also the organic salad is marinated with curry dressing, so the 2 Indian dishes make me feel sick in my stomach. I kindly posted a pic of ravioli.

Reviews.Title: “Most Beautiful View In Boston”
Reviews.Author: Fllblueguy
Reviews.Content: As you can see by other reviews here, this Hotel is one of the Best in the Boston Area. There is nothing bad to say about the Hyatt Boston Harbor side. If you are one of the lucky ones to get a room with a harbor view, it is just priceless. When you enter the Lobby and you see all downtown Boston in front of you through these huge glass windows, you forget for a moment the reason you are there. The room are so comfortable and clean. The bed is so mmmmmmmmmmmmmmm. ( that's how I describe it) and the bathrooms are very nice and modern. This was my second time here and I will say I definitely will come back again. I know is right next to the Airport , but you can take the ferry next to the Hotel to Down Town. The food downstairs is so good. The only thing was a little bit overpriced breakfast, but the staff was friendly and the view to the harbor is just wonderful. Front desk was very helpful and super nice, especially the front desk manager Ryan. If you have something bad to say about the rooms or this hotel you have to be a very mad and sad person. I'm sure the views of the harbor side will make your mood change at least during your stay. YOU WILL LOVE THIS HOTEL. * * * * *

Reviews.Title: “Checked out after 4 hours.”
Reviews.Author: SP103
Reviews.Content: Ok. So in fairness, I will give positives first. The view from the room was amazing. I only paid $99 for a Harborside room view via the E-Hyatt deals. Also, The night manager was extremely nice when we left. She handled us leaving a bag in the room and forgetting our keys and while the valet was on a break got our car brought around. We didn't even bother checking out officially. The video check-out wasn't working, and we weren't in the mood to deal with anyone at that point. I reserved a room, City/Ocean King view with the E-Hyatt deals program. I called the hotel and specifically asked if any of the rooms facing the city were smoking rooms. I was told "yes, no problem". When we arrived, I was told "we don't have any smoking rooms facing the harbor". I was immediately angered. I took the N/S room facing the harbor because thats the reason me and my fiancee came here. On the TV, No NESN or Fox.Comcast channels (Bruins, Red Sox, Celtics). When we entered, we found the bathroom was covered in black hairs on the walls, shower and floor. Even though the clerk at check in stated it was a Non smoking room, the room next door smelled like cigarettes and cigars. What hotel seriously allows smoking rooms next to non-smoking rooms? Because our room was non-smoking, a nice little note was left stating a $250 charge would be assessed if we smoked in the room. We could smell the other smoke from the neighbors. We had to go down 4 flights and to the front to smoke because we were afraid of our $99 turning into over a $400 night. We watched a movie, and decided at 11PM to order room service. Closed. What four star hotel closes room service at 11 PM, especially if it's in the middle of nowhere when the airport restaurants close. We had enough of enduring having to smoke outside when I specifically reserved a Harborview smoking room and a dirty room. We attempted to make coffee for the ride home, and their was 1 coffee packet. Room service coffee in the morning would of been $10 for a small pot (we didn;t make it to the AM hours).I am usually generous in my reviews here on tripadvisor, and this is the worst place I've ever stayed at. If your stuck at the airport, go to the Hilton. Yea, I'm going to complain to Hyatt Corporate. If they can guarantee non-smoking rooms, they should do the opposite for us smokers. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Views Don't Equal Bad Dining”
Reviews.Author: nino001
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this Hyatt after flying into Boston for Thanksgiving. We found our high floor view room to be usual high Hyatt quality, offering outstanding views of Boston Harbor. All the usual amenities which have made me a longtime Hyatt Gold Passport member were in place. The restaurant however left a lot be desired, really dampening what would otherwise be a better review. Both times we ate there (dinner, breakfast) service was spotty, items listed on the menu were not available and substitutes offered didn't meet our expectations. If we weren't so tired from flying across country we would have eaten out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too pricey”
Reviews.Author: Utefan11
Reviews.Content: If you stay there be sure to get a room that overlooks the harbor the view cant be beat. The food prices were way to high is my only complaint. They were high even for hotels I thought. Just seems wrong to pay $20 for an breakfast for one person. Also for the price you would think they would have a fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajlangford
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at this hotel. We had a room on the 9th floor overlooking the harbor. What a beautiful view! We got into town around 1230 and figured it would be too early to check in. we called and talked to someone at the front desk and he said there were some rooms available and we could try and get one of those on a first come first serve basis. He also said if our room was ready we could have that one. We were in luck our room was ready and we checked before 1pm. We had parked in the pay lot not knowing if we would be able to get in. It is expensive! $10 for the first hour alone. We were getting rid of our rental car and were going to pay for our ticket. we were in the lot less than an hour and expected to pay the fee. The Concierge waived the fee which was super nice of them to do. Our room was really nice. My only complaint was the room was stocked with only one washcloth...which was weird. The water taxi area is right behind the hotel which was nice. ALso we had no issues with the shuttle in the Am. We waited about 10 mintues for the shuttle to take us to the airport. All in all it was a nice place. I might think differently though if I was going on vacation there because of its distance from downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Setting, But...”
Reviews.Author: francis54
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights. Hotel sits about a mile from terminals at Logan. It's a fabulous setting overlooking Boston Harbor, with pristine rooms, great bedding and wonderful health club & pool. Only one shortfall - the free hotel shuttle service from the airport or after visiting the city. You could wait for an hour... The shuttle that takes you to the airport or the T-Station is much more on-time. I'm guessing they need to run an additional vehicle...One suggestion I learned about the shuttle - if visiting or touring the city, have the driver deliver you directly to the airport T-station (blue line) and get a card from him that includes a phone number you can call for pick-up at the same T-Station upon your return. Or, upon your return to the Airport T-Station after touring, look for the free Logan Airport Shuttle marked "Boat Dock" - it will take you directly to the Water Taxi station that sits beside the Hyatt Harborside...Would I stay here again - Absolutely! Especially @ $99 through the Hyatt website.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service and way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: jc250ex
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™re looking to spend a night in Boston I do not recommend the Hyatt at the airport. The hotel itself is very nice, with a painted ceiling over the front desk and very modern style rooms; however itâ€™s not the rooms that make the hotel itâ€™s the service and the prices/location. On the bus ride to the hotel from the airport I asked the bus driver where the nearest liqueur store was (sorry but Iâ€™m not paying $8 for a cheap beer), for some reason he looked at me like I was some kind of scum bag alcoholic. He replied in a nasty voice "I DON'T LIVE AROUND HERE I WOULDNT KNOW, AND YOU CANT BRING ALCOHOL INTO THE HOTEL! DOES THAT ANSWER YOUR QUESTION?". I also caught attitude from the freakin' bell boy that night. After all that i was walking around with my fists in the air. I couldnâ€™t believe it, I mean super 8 would treat me better (it would be a hell of alot cheaper too). So for some reason you don't take my advice and stay there, just hear this warning, eat at the airport before you go to the hotel because there is NOTHING around it, and a $14 sandwich at the hotel fits in the palm of your hand, don't get thirsty cause beer starts at 7 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Halls”
Reviews.Author: govs99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Harborside with my wife recently. Having frequented the other two major airport hotels (Hilton and Embassy Suites) I was quite disappointed with the Hyatt. The staff was great, as was the room decor and the pool area. This all could not make up for the noise of the building during the night. The walls in this hotel are very thin and you can hear quite a bit of what I would consider normal noise from your neighbors. Also, whenever a door in the hallway closes, it echoed throughout your room. The views from this hotel are spectacular. For airplane enthusiasts the even numbered side of the hallway views the runways at Logan, while the odd side has a view of the Boston skyline and harbor. These views are quite a waste because of the hall noise. We did not park, however the daily rate was in excess of 30 USD per day. Other than the spectacular views, everything this hotel offers can be found at the Hilton or Embassy Suites usually at a similar or even lower cost.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing water views”
Reviews.Author: Lulu59
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an amazing stay at the Hyatt Harborside in Boston. It was an excellent experience and I highly recommend it. We shopped around for prices and they were competitive with hotels that did not offer 1/3 in amenities, service, etc. Very luxurious surroundings and gorgeous views from the moment you arrive welcome you from the moment you arrive. The gorgeous views from a large picture window continued in our room and we did not even stay in a suite. The service was excellent and the best part is that they are five minutes from the airport via the hotel shuttle. They have an outdoor patio looking at the Boston skyline/harbor that takes your breath away as you have a wonderful and complete breakfast buffet, cocktails or dinner. Anytime during your stay you can hop on the water taxi and it will take you across the harbor to downtown boston in less than 10 minutes. We received free tickets during our stay but if it is not included in your package you can purchase them from the front desk for $14.00. They will drop you off at various locations, ie., Aquarium, Fanuel Hall, etc. This was a great stay and I highly recommend this hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbcoach
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We just finished a 2-week, 14-day stay through the East Coast and stayed in some of the top hotels on the East Coast, and I can honestly tell you that this hotel was as good as each hotel, maybe more, at a fraction of the cost. I booked this trip on a deal I saw on travelzoo for an incredible $129 per night......a steal compared to rates I was quoted from the hotel directly. We were concerned because of the location of this hotel, but that vanished quickly when we saw the view the Harborside gave us of downtown Boston. It was simply stunning. We hung out at the hotel restaurant, which was very good. We stayed outside on lounge chairs and had a great time. The kids loved the pool. The service was incredible. We were greeted warmly by an incredible bellman, who helped us with everything. The front desk staff was very nice, and helped us with any questions we had. We didn't have one problem. Our only regret is that we didn't stay longer than the original 3 days we had planned. IT WAS THAT GOOD! Honestly, we stayed at the Sofitel in Philly, and this hotel was better. The rooms were clean and roomy. The beds were incredibly comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The Clam Chowder on at the restaurant was as good as any we had on our trip, and believe me, we had alot. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Boston. It is a quick trip by taxi, or even more fun, by water taxi, to downtown Boston. This is a great hotel, with great people, great food, and a great location......as long as you aren't too hung up on being directly downtown. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Harborside nice and convenient to the city”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Hotwire, and like usual, I was quite pleased in terms of money well spent. The hotel, while next to the airport, is also conveniently close to the city, and it is easy to take the T in and out. The best thing about the hotel is the view from the rooms if you are on the harbor side, followed by its convenient location. The worst things are that it is isolated, so you have little choice in terms of food, and that it still takes a bit of time to get from the airport to the hotel as the shuttle makes all sorts of stops. Also, the hotel is remarkable in that there is almost/virtually no airplane noise, in spite of being at the end of the runway, but you can hear people in adjacent rooms a bit more than usual. On the whole, I would not hesitate to stay here. Oh, if you stay out here (or maybe anywhere in Boston), get the pass for the T. It is going to be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, appalling Service”
Reviews.Author: JCherry
Reviews.Content: The beds were typical Hyatt comfort and the bathrooms were pretty cramped. Nothing special. The service on the other hand will be why I never go back there. The way they handled non-existent water pressure in my room was very weak. They claimed that it was actually supposed to be that way, then claimed they fixed it when it wasn't, and finally they moved me to another room but treated me like I extorted the room change from them. For me it is not a problem in a hotel that bothers me, but how it is resolved. If you stay here, pray nothing out of the ordinary happens to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: norscio
Reviews.Content: I purchased this stay on Priceline. It was for one Saturday night on a leisure trip with my girlfriend. It cost $76 and I likely could have successfully bid even cheaper. I was concerned because of its location - near the airport, away from downtown and too far from mass transit to walk - and the $30 parking charge. I felt perhaps I would spend my savings on parking, etc., especially after reading some reviews. We had a great experience. We avoided the parking charge by leaving the car in an underground garage five blocks from Quincy Market for $9 per night. The shuttle came rather promptly going in and out. Finally, they gave us a 12th floor harbor room with arguably the most picture perfect view I've ever had. Room was immaculate, staff seemed friendly, didn't eat there, river walk was great, pool was closed for a camera shoot and appeared small. Bedding was great as was the bathroom and toiletries. You likely will hear people leaving in nearby rooms very early but you WON'T hear airplanes. Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again, unless we got the room for even cheaper”
Reviews.Author: mantez16
Reviews.Content: We purchased the stay at this hotel from Hotwire for $90 a night. They def. stuck us in a very crappy room. We had views of the airport, tons of stains on the carpet and the hallway of our floor was a complete MESS! (ceiling covers missing, stains on the carpet and walls) It def. scared us before we entered the room. There were some good things about the hotel: 1)the bed was comfortable with a nice down comforter, 2)the shower was pretty roomy (they had the shower rod that curves out, giving you more room), 3)they had free transportation to the airport (and from there you can take the Silver line to downtown Boston), and 4)the restaurant downstairs was awesome with great food and view of Boston. Overall, we def. got what we paid for. I wouldn't stay here again unless we got a room for even cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “More than just an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExtraPickles
Reviews.Content: Five years ago, we spent our wedding night at the Hyatt Harborside. Given that we were only there to crash and take an early flight the following morning, we never had a chance to really enjoy the hotel. So for our fifth anniversary, we decided to return. Smart move! Don't let the industrial ride to the Hyatt turn you off. The hotel is right on the water, with immediate access to a waterfront walking trail. The clean hotel rooms are wonderfully furnished and accessorized in an elegant-yet-modern style. The roller shades do a great job in blocking out the morning sun and the windowproofing completely shut out any airline noise. We had a room on the 8th floor with a harborview. From some locations in our room, it looked like we were right on the water. The fitness room has a great selection of up-to-date workout equipment. The pool is amazing -- it is filled with saline water, so there is no strong chlorine smell. Brunch is a great bargain with the business plan. Lots of hot and cold choices to choose from, with again, a great view of the harbor. The service was average, primarily due to a disconnect between the reservation and front desks. Somehow the reservation desk booked us for two rooms. When this was brought to my attention at check in, I explained that there was no need for an extra room and that I was puzzled by the doublebooking. The desk clerk said twice to me "Oh, well, we'll cancel the second room free of charge." Her comment made it seem like she was doing me a big favor by rectifying a mistake her colleague made. And while the reservation desk said that we'd have a king bed with a harborview, the desk clerk said that only doubles w/that view are available for that price. She said she'd do me a favor by charging me a discounted additional rate for the king room; I declined. The best service came from the airport shuttle staff. Friendly guys who'd answer any questions about the hotel, Boston, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but a little pricey”
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel with a couple of minor drawbacks... First of all the good things: Pleasant room with a great view of the Harbour, clean, staff were friendly and helpful. There is a small gym and indoor swimming pool also with great views. and now the not so good things: 1) Location - The hotel is situated at Boston Logan Airport quite a distance from the city centre. I was here at a conference but if you are here sightseeing Boston then a downtown hotel would suit you better. There is a water taxi from outside the hotel that you have to pay for or alternatively the nearest metro station is around three quarters of a mile away. 2) Cost - Not only were the rooms expensive, you had to pay extra breakfast and extra for internet access. I paid over 850 dollars for four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, no results”
Reviews.Author: sf3456
Reviews.Content: In general, a great location and beautiful views. The water taxi service is also a great plus if you want to go downtown. But I have some serious reservations about the service. We arrived on a Friday night and were told we had the last room in the place. Seeing as I had reserved it very recently (a few days ago) and my travel companions had done the same (we had 4 rooms total), I found that hard to believe. So they didn't give us the two doubles but instead a king. That's OK, we had a cot. But the walls in the room were paper thin - you could hear conversations going on next door - and it was a handicapped room with no space in the bathroom to put anything down. It was terrible. The Hyatt fixed it the next day and we moved to a much better room on the other side of the hotel - however, I left my cell phone charger behind (for literally 6 hours) and then they could not find it. I've called back 2-3 times and always get the same nice but totally unhelpful response. Very frustrating!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: danoconn3ll
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very well equipped and clean, the bathroom was spotless save for a crack in the sink. I found the restaurant to be very good though expensive (typical of hotels), but the steak and lobster were well prepared and we enjoyed ourselves. We did not have to wait at all for the bus from Logan to the airport, both arriving and departing buses were immediately available. The hotel and restaurant staff was very friendly and helpful. Will definitely come back again especially for the view.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view at the Hyatt Harborside”
Reviews.Author: Greylady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Harborside on both ends of a trip to Costa Rica, as we had an early a.m. flight out of Logan on the way down and a very late p.m. flight on the way back. We booked through Priceline, so weren't sure what kind of room we'd be in, but were more than pleasantly surprised given the rate we got. The night before we left, we had an 11th floor harbor side view of the city that was incredible. On the return we were "upgraded" from the room we had booked to a 3rd floor harbor view that was not as impressive as the 11th floor, but still better than any airport hotel we've ever stayed at (besides, at 1:30 a.m. you don't much care if you have a view, and in the morning you're busy getting ready to leave). In both cases the rooms were good- size, clean, the beds were very comfortable and had all the amenities (the only thing that didn't work was the iron in the 1st room). We agree with other reviewers about the staff - exceptionally friendly, professional and helpful. However, we had an entirely different experience with the shuttle service than most of the other reviews we read. It was prompt, the drivers were friendly and knowledgeable - one even gave us all a little "tour-guide" routine along the way, and explained the hotel's amenities as well. We'd also have to agree with the reviews of the restaurant. Extremely overpriced, and no other option on site. We ordered room service off the bar menu (speedy, friendly staff, not gourmet food, but good) and dined in front of the picture window looking out over the harbor at the twinkling lights of the city. It was a great start to our vacation! We wouldn't hesitate to return and have already recommended to others planning to do the Logan shuffle.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyTrips
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a nice location. Pretty view of the harbor if you are lucky enough to get a room on that side of the hotel. The room was clean and beds weren't bad. Pill's were OK. My bathroom shower had mold in between the tiles which I wasn't a fan of and I did find a hair in the bathroom. Yuck The hotel lobby seemed busy everynight, like there was a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but....”
Reviews.Author: dollarcautious
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary visit to Boston. The hotel is clean and staff is polite. The location is a fine alternative to the generally more pricey downtown hotels. The hotel provides a free shuttle service to/from the airport and the nearby underground/subway station. Unfortunately, there were several occurances including our initial pickup from the airport where the communications between driver and hotel dispatcher were very slow or non existent resulting in long delays while waiting for this pickup. We weren't the only ones finding this misfortune...one fellow waited for over 1 hour at the airport car hire office and after two calls to the hotel was finally picked up by the shuttle we were on. The driver told him no one had told him someone was waiting. Thus, you must build in much more time than necessary to your schedule for travel to and from downtown, the airport, etc. Also, the whirlpool hot tub although very clean would not run...only very hot standing water. The hotel only offers one very highly priced restaurant. It has great views but considering the isolated location of the hotel adjacent to the airport, they have a captive audience and we felt taken advantage of. Apparently in former perhaps more prosperous times, there was an additional dining room option. Suggestion: We brought in tasty hand made pastries and fruit from Boston's 'little Italy' the night before for the next morning's breakfast. There is complementary room coffee and tea. Generally, I'd say, stay here understanding there might be some glitches and if the price appears lower than some other nearby options.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: ojy
Reviews.Content: While this hotel was a good deal, it wasn't a great deal. Have stayed there before but the place is going downhill and seems a bit frayed at the edges. There were stains on the hall floors. I remembered their terrific restaurant, but it is now closed and the only restaurant is crammed in to what was previously the bar area only. The menu for dinner is extremely expensive and the bar menu, which has lighter and more reasonably priced fare was very limited. We ordered pizza delivered to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're flying out of Logan”
Reviews.Author: Tim2458
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Harborside New Year's Day because we had an early flight to St. Maarten the following morning. As Hyatt Gold Club members, we were upgraded to a harbor view room which was spacious, comfortable, extremely clean, quiet, and a great value at $119 for the night (booked via the Hyatt Web site). The staff were courteous and even the other guests were friendly. While we did not use the workout room or pool, both looked nice. We did not eat there so we can't comment on the food. There is a stop for the water taxi at the hotel, which is convenient. We parked out car at the hotel, so I can't comment on the shuttle other than it was loading passengers when we left the hotel. There is a very small business center and a computer in the lobby entrance where you can check on flight and parking garage status, and print your boarding pass. This is my second stay at this Hyatt and, based on my experiences, I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices”
Reviews.Author: rabble
Reviews.Content: The only reason I can think of that you would want to stay at an airport hotel is just before or after traveling, if you are coming to Boston for any other reason why not stay across the river in the city, there are so many good hotels to chose from â€“ at a comparable price. First the good, this hotel has a spectacular view of Boston from across the harbor. Other than that, it is an average hotel; clean, modern (wasnâ€™t built that long ago) and the service is ok, nothing spectacular. What I couldnâ€™t understand about this Hyatt is that it as an airport hotel, therefore, at a minimum you would expect good shuttle service from the hotel to the terminals. I asked about the schedule, and was told there is one shuttle bus that makes continual runs. Based on how many people are on the bus, your wait for it in the main lobby can be anywhere from 10 minutes to Â½ an hour. I travel a lot on business and for an airport hotel not to offer a regular schedule (shuttle bus leaving every 15 minutes, etc.) is ridiculous. Logan airport gets very crowded, as expected we spent close to Â½ an hour waiting for the shuttle bus in the lobby of the hotelâ€¦they need to have more than just one. My advice, if you need to stay at Logan airport, I would select the Hilton. At the very least I always see their shuttle buses at the terminals and they clearly have more than one. If you are visiting Boston, cross the river and stay in the cityâ€¦.for the premium you pay for an airport hotel, you can stay at a nice downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great position, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: camdencalling
