Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first night in Boston at the end of October and then on my last night in early December and it was an excellent choice. Really welcoming staff on the front desk. Excellent conceirge staff who gave extremely good advice for getting to South Station. Quick and regular shuttle service to and from the airport. When my husband arrived we realised that we were missing his briefcase with laptop which had not been put in our cab at our previous hotel in Cambridge. Hyatt staff immediately took control of phoning the Marlowe and organising for its prompt arrival and did everything to reassure us. The small pool is a bonus particularly with the stunning views and sunset. Excellent breakfast (an extra of course as it usually is in the US) and friendly and attentive serving staff. Rooms were very quiet and comfortable. Lovely products in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: montieds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay. The hotel was exceptionally clean. I don't agree with the other comments about the noise. We had a room on the airport side of the hotel, and though we were just blocks from the runway, it was astonishingly quiet. You could hear the low rumble of the jets as they took off, but it was not a nuisance. The staff was friendly and helpful. The harbor water taxi stop is only steps away and will put you downtown in a few minutes for 10$. The Hyatt shuttle bus was excellent and free and we never had a wait of more than 10 minutes at any pick up point. We used the shuttle daily to get to the T stop. Our drivers were always friendly and courteous. Room service food was expensive, but when isn't it. Who want's to eat a 40$ steak in your room when you are only 30 minutes tops from some of the best restaurants in the country?

Reviews.Title: “Finally a perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: brokenankle
Reviews.Content: My son and I have stayed here many times and there have always been issues (please see my previous reviews). We arrived on a Monday afternoon and were immediately upgraded to a Harbor View room on a high floor. The room was perfect. room service stellar and our dinner in the restaurant divine. The hot tub was actually working and it was even hot! The front desk staff was very accomdating. My 8 year old son had a 7:45 am appointment at the Massachusetts Eye Research and Surgical Institute. I didn't know how long we would be gone and was concerned about checking out in time. No problem; the front desk gave us a late check out and was willing to check us out and hold our bags if we didn't make it back in time (which we didn't). I honestly don't know if service levels at this property have improved or if they are getting sick and tired of my complaints. I am a Hyatt Platinum Passport member and yes, I do expect perfection. I am happy to report that on my last stay I received it.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: Travelfreak101
Reviews.Content: In all my travels, I have never seen a hotel staff so rude and unresponsive. My husband and I were attending a conference, so we brought my parents to babysit. We had requested connecting, non-smoking rooms. When we arrived at the hotel, the rooms we had requested were not available. The only rooms even on the same floor were smoking. It took 1 1/2 hours to check in. When I requested a Manager, he came out listened to my story and looked at the front desk clerk who obiviously did not know how to run the computer and said, "You handle it." We went up to see how bad the smoke was in one room and I called the front desk. The clerk said, "We are busy, I will call you right back." After 10 minutes, I went back downstairs. The Manager and the two clerks were standing there talking and laughing. At this point, it was not funny. I needed to get tired kids to bed. We decided to take the smoking rooms to be on the same floor, with the intention to move the next day. I stopped by the desk the next day to let the new staff know our situation. They did nothing. The Manager would not return phone calls to our room. We found a Hampton Inn right down the street. It was beautiful, smoke free and $100.00 cheaper a night. With two rooms that really adds up. Save yourself the hassle, stay at the Hampton. The lunch buffet was expensive and not good either and we had to unload our own luggage because a bell boy was not available.

Reviews.Title: “looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: burke140
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 years in a row for a short, 3-day business meeting. The view is great, facilities are very nice and location is perfect for business travelers. The good things pretty much end there. Staff is not that friendly and food quality was very poor. There is nothing but a sheer curtain to cover the large window in each room. This may not be a problem if you face the harbor, but I faced the airport and it was very bright and loud with the construction going on 24 hours a day. Also, the water pressure in the bathroom sink was non-existant...Made it very difficult to shave. Good luck if you dtay here more then 2-3 days...you'll be ready for home!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: simon50
Reviews.Content: Oh Dear! I have stayed in several Hyatts throughout the world very successfully, but this was simply awful. At $199 per night here is the reality....... 1) The Hyatt shuttle was so slow I was the last person waiting for transportation at Boston Airport. The hotel is less than 500yrds away and it took 1hr from getting my bags to checking in at the Hotel! This was also true on the way back with other people complaining about when the Shuttle would arrive (I waited 10 mins but I guess I was luckier on the way back). All the staff could say was that they were "busy today" 2) The room was a "disabled" room with a pathetic bathroom, no bath and a wasbasin about 18" square 3) The rooms are very noisy. Anyone talking in the corridor can be heard - and as the room was the 1st room from the lifts I could hear everyone coming to their room - this ended around 1am in the morning 4) This is an airport hotel, so I got woken at 5am, when people started leaving to get their flights, by the lack of soundproofing in the doors. 5) As previously stated in another post - you cannot close the curtains. There is a blind but this is not completey suitable so light does get in easily 6) The front desk looked amazed when I responded to their question "and how was your stay" with a "not very good" answer. All they could say was "I am sorry, I am sorry" like some scratchy record. No offer to see what was wrong or attempt to fix it. 7) I'm glad I didn't pick up the hire car until the following day when I checked-out as they would have stung me for another $30. This was a truly bad experience. I will never stay there again. It is not value for money and my previous view of the Hyatt brand (which previously I have had the very highest regard for) has been destroyed.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all pleased with my Hyatt experience”
Reviews.Author: Webini
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Harborside on 7/29 for one night. Rate was $90 thru Priceline. As others have said the location has a beautiful view of the water on one side, but is located right at Logan airport. This is great if you are taking a flight. If you want to see Boston there are much better options unless you have a car. As I said the view of the harbour is beautiful - it you can see it! Our room had a lovely view of the parking lot. This is probably because it was a Priceline reservation but don't expect to automatically get the nice view. Several complaints about this hotel. The first being that you cannot close the curtains! There is a "privacy" curtain that is very thin but you cannot close the drapes. This is a major problem if you have a room facing the parking lot as the room is very bright at sunrise and there is not a thing you can do about it. No fridge, no minibar. The towels you could literally see through. The TV is vintage 1990. Dust you could write your name in on the top of the bed. Oh yeah, and $30 parking!!!! We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: momentum12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my teenager for 3 nights in July. Nice Boston hotels are very expensive, but we got a good rate thru Hyatt.com. Our room was clean, and very quiet. The hotel staff was friendly and accomodating. They have one restaurant with a breakfast buffet that was great. This hotel is right next to the water taxi dock. The MBTA commuter boat (F2, F2H, see MBTA.com) runs across the harbor to downtown, about 5-10 minute ride. Also the Rowes Wharf Water Taxi, and the Boston Water Taxi. If you buy a round trip ticket on the taxi, note the DIFFERENT company. There are several stops in downtown, so it is easy to get around. The Hyatt shuttle can take awhile for pickups from the T blue line stop, so the water transportation is a lot faster. Also, with all but one tunnel closed in the city, traffic via cab can be bad. Next to the dock, the T runs a shuttle to the airlines, which is quick and easy, as there is always a bus there. Take the water taxi to Long Wharf or IMAX, and cross over to Faneuil Hall. Walk down the main market and get some of the best food ever at a decent price. Boston, $$$ to live in and visit, but one of a kind. Go Sox!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but staff needs to rally!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with a view that takes your breath away, and the comfort of the king size bed was superior...however, the hotel staff really needs to kick it up a notch. We never felt welcome during our stay, nor did we feel that those who worked wanted to be there. The staff looked unhappy and rather stressed. After checking in we needed to change rooms when we found the bathroom sink drain broken and hair in the tub, and soap from a previous guest was left as a bonus. We were amazed to have to struggle with our luggage while hotel staff stood by, more thqn once. At one point we found ourselves helping out others who were in need of assistance. Be aware: Overnight parking costs $30.00.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View of Boston Harbor”
Reviews.Author: LouisvilleGuy
Reviews.Content: The view of Boston Harbor and the city skyline is super, especially from its 15th floor! The room was clean, well appointed, and quiet. A courtesy shuttle provides around-the-clock service to the airport or nearby subway stop. The staff was helpful and cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: agirlinfin2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our first night of our honeymoon here. We had a flight early the next morning to head down to Florida. Check-in was easy, the person asked us if we wanted a harbour view and we were glad we asked. Our room was a good size, clean, and everything worked as it was suppose to. We ordered room service and the person who brought the food was very nice. The next day when we went to leave checking out was very easy. The hotel has a shuttle to take you to the airport. Our driver was extremely helpful, and made the short drive enjoyable. This is a super hotel to stay at for a night, or longer. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel without the Price Tag”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Harborside for one night because I had an early morning flight out of Logan and wanted every last minute of sleep that I could get. The hotel was amazing, and a great value for the $139 per night I paid through the Hyatt website. My room was tastefully furnished, with a plush and generously-pillowed king-size bed, loveseat couch with coffee table, desk and desk chair, dresser, and large TV. I especially appreciated the coffee maker and to-go paper cups. I took the T from downtown to the airport and then took the hotel shuttle bus to the hotel. The shuttle was a bit slow to arrive (maybe 15-20 minutes waiting time). I also took the shuttle from the hotel to the airport the following morning, which was extremely speedy, with the shuttle waiting outside the hotel when I got there and dropping me off at my terminal within 7 minutes. Dinner at the hotel's restaurant was good, but overpriced at $28 for a basic veal scallopini dinner dish with spinach and risotto. For future reference, I think I would have ordered room service which had some options in the $12-18 range. Given that the hotel is near the airport and little else, you're a captive audience and don't have much choice of dining options. That said, the wait staff was pleasant and ambiance enjoyable. When I let them know that I needed to eat quickly because I was expecting a business call back in my room, they graciously expedited things. I didn't explore the pool, gym, bar or business center, but I gather that they all existed. The walls were thin enough that I could hear a bit of the conversation of my nextdoor neighbor, as well as his television. However, it wasn't so loud that it kept me from being able to fall asleep. Service was excellent, with the front desk staff always addressing me by name when I called down with questions, and delivering wake-up calls (yes plural, I needed a follow-up call to make sure I hadn't fallen back asleep) in an non-automated and timely manner. Overall, the Hyatt Harborside had the feel of a much more expensive hotel, but without the large price tag. I would certainly choose to stay here again for a night before or after a flight from Logan.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before a morning flight to the BVI. The room we had with the view of Boston and Boston Harbor was breathtaking and the service was impeccable. I'll definately be back. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Sharonb423
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel while attending a meeting in Boston and while the hotel was nice and clean (even during construction), the service was terrible! After waiting for 1/2 hour to be waited on, we finally called a waiter over to take an order. Another 1/2 hour later we left for our meeting without being served - even though we ordered soup and sandwiches. Going back to my room hours later, I then couldn't reach anyone for room service, called the front desk and waited 15 minutes for someone to call back. The meeting we had the next day was overpowered by the meeting in the next room; our speaker could not be heard above the noise. No bill under the door for quick checkout, no one asked me how my stay was (I would have told them). While the hotel was decent, there are better places to stay, with better service, in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: From the big, soothing rooms, to the calm and spacious lobby, to the killer views of downtown Boston, I very much enjoyed my Jan. 13-15 stay at the Hyatt Harborside. The lobby is elegant and minimalist, and refreshingly calm. It's got nice seating areas with huge windows offering you an incredible (and I do mean incredible) view of Boston's skyline, particularly at night. The hotel is also very pleasantly fragrant - they must definitely scent the air because the lobby, elevators and hallways all have a hint of fragrance. The rooms are large and comfortable, with more modern minimalism, excellent in-room furnishings (great work desk and a sofa) and comfortable beds with too many pillows! Bathrooms are large and modern, with Portico bath amenities (No body lotion tho - it must be a Hyatt thing). I agree that the room service is pricey, but it's also very good. In-room movie and entertainment options are great. The workout room next to the indoor pool is very nice, again offering a great view of Boston. I agree with many posters on the location. It's fine for access to Logan, but waiting on shuttles to get to and from the T station to go to and from Boston or Cambridge is time-consuming. The shuttle drivers are friendly and accommodating though, but make sure you keep 50 cents in change or a cell phone to call for the shuttle from the T station. There's NOTHING of interest in the immediate area around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Belfastbt4
Reviews.Content: Noisey dirty wall paper off the walls .Towels dirty and disgusting yellow stuff present on towel surface. Unbelievable staff unhelpful and when we compained about noise they sent a staff member to our room when the culprits of the noise where in the corridor which just fuelled their noise . Rooms very dirty and tatty . Never again will we waste our money .

Reviews.Title: “Robbed me of $28 to park my car 1 night”
Reviews.Author: JPNNH
Reviews.Content: Hotel had nice view...bed was comfortable...TV was small & cheap...Room Service was priced way too high...Coffee $6.00, Hamburger $10.00 etc then they add 15% tip, then they add 3% hotel surcharge then they add $3.00 for delivery fee (isnt that what the gratuity is for?) But the parking charge was the most outrageous charge on the bill...

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Harborside at Boston's Logan International Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 101 Harborside Drive, Boston, MA 02128
